strIntroduction: An alternative to our Chinatown tours and conveniently located near the popular traveler mecca of Khao San Road, our tour will explore the historic community of Bang Lamphu through routes familiar only to locals. Departing from the New World City Hotel, we will go behind the flashing lights of Khao San Road to begin our cultural adventure. Leaving crowded traditional tourist attractions for your guidebook to detail, we will bring you along a path of discovery not found in any of them. Wooden framed houses, noisy schoolyards, and bustling markets are just a few examples of scenes you might find on our wander into the common but always fascinating life styles of the Thai people. Next, we cross the Chao Phraya River over the breath-taking Rama VIII Bridge to historic Thonburi. With expansive views of the river still fresh in our memories, encounters with surprising green belts free of cars and tourists will signal your arrival to a Bangkok you never knew.
strTitle: Bike Khao San Road's hidden streets and back alleys

strIntroduction: Our school focuses on authentic Thai cuisine and provides friendly and professional instructors. Our cooking classes are easy to learn. We will even take you to go shopping to buy your own Thai food ingredients so that it will be easier for you to remember and learn about the cuisine. Our local market is very rustic, retaining the authentic Thai lifestyle. Besides cooking, there are a lot of things to learn as well during our trip to the market and our classes. In this course, you will choose seven dishes, one of each category, including making curry paste.
strTitle: Learn to cook authentic Thai cuisine

strIntroduction: Of course people in Thailand can't understand Japanese. But they know one Japanese word. That is "OISHI". This word is as same as the name of company in Thailand, so they can understand it. If you go travel in Thailand and say "OISHI" in a restaurant, people there will understand you and be happy. You'll be glad if people understand what you are talking? In order to get easier to make people understand you, here is one lesson. That is "Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand". There are lots of accents in Thai. If you buy a Thai language book before travel, mostly you'll end up not communicating with people. In this lesson, there are just minimum required words for travel. But i f you know some, you'll enjoy more. "Words used on a taxi" "Words used in shopping" "Words used at a hotel" This lesson will support your travel and safety. For your trip, Thai people and your safety, please take this lesson! Besides, you also can experience Thai food because this lesson includes drink and lunch at the restaurant "J-cafe". Let's join us!
strTitle: Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand 2hours

strIntroduction: This is the lesson for people who are not satisfied with 2-hours course. We'll teach you not only conversations just for travel but also ones for making friends in Thailand. There are some techniques in languages. So we'll pick up what the most important part is for leaning Thai and teach you them. Then you'll feel "I can speak Thai!!!!" though this lesson. After 2-hours lesson which is a basic version, you'll take more 2-hours lesson which is a practical one. Between 2 lesson, you can have a lunch, so let's use Thai at the time! Pleasure in trip is enjoying people and cultures in the country, Let's have a fun in Thailand through this opportunity.
strTitle: Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand 4hours

strIntroduction: Do you like Thailand? Do you like Thai people and the culture? Why not study Thai then? It is one of the most beautiful languages, as the sounds and tones are almost melodic. With your knowledge of Thai, you can communicate with the locals directly. We are a translation company with language experts, and will provide you with a day's worth of effective and interesting Thai lessons. The teachers are university students! As you know it is impossible to speak a new language after a one day lesson. But, you will understand the essence of the language and remember some useful words and phrases. We provide three courses. "First Speak Thai in My Life", "Survival in The Country" and "Master of Thai Conversation." After a day of Thai lessons, you will be the object of envy and wonder as you chatter away in simple and useful Thai phrases!
strTitle: One Day Thai Lesson by University Students

strIntroduction: Travel like a VIP and arrive hours before the large tour groups to Cu Chi Tunnels - one of the most worthy historical sites to visit in Vietnam. Your guide will introduce life along the banks of the Saigon River as your boat gracefully glides through knots of floating water hyacinths on this scenic one-hour boat trip. When you arrive at Cu Chi, after a short documentary, your guide will lead you through the historic Cu Chi Tunnels, dug by resourceful guerrilla fighters to provide communication and supply routes, hospitals, food and weapon caches and living quarters during numerous conflicts. You will hear an explanation about the tunnel system, how people lived and survived through all those years, then have a chance to taste traditional local food and tea. A traditional Vietnamese lunch or dinner of local specialties will be served on-board after your visit to the tunnels. Tour starts at 7.15 AM or 1.30PM everyday.
strTitle: Ride on a speedboat and visit the Cu Chi Tunnels

strIntroduction: Enjoy a fast, scenic speedboat trip through the Mekong Delta. Departing from HCMC’s central pier, you will explore areas of the Mekong Delta that few other tourists get to experience. Key cultural stops include a Cao Dai Temple, a riverside market, local workshops, a pagoda and other historical sites. Enjoy countless opportunities to capture amazing photos, spend time at a family homestead, where you’ll be invited to enjoy refreshing, freshly cut coconuts and fiery Mekong whisky. Later our chef will prepare many Vietnamese dishes, such as fried elephant ear fish – a Mekong Delta speciality – served at a local pagoda or school for underprivileged children. Itinerary • Your guide will meet you in the lobby of your hotel at 7:30am and bring you by car to your boat at HCMC’s central pier. • Leave the city via narrow canals and enter the verdant green tributaries of the Mekong Delta. • Enjoy a brief stop at a local pagoda. • Breakfast of light pastries, local fruit and Vietnamese coffee served on the boat. • Visit a bustling local riverside market as local producers buy and sell rice, fish and colorful fruits and vegetables. • Visit a local Mekong Delta village and stroll through terraced rice paddies and sugarcane fields. • Stop at a traditional wooden house. • Visit a local crafts workshop and view Bonsai tree pottery. • Travel along small canopy shaded canals in the Thu Thua area. • Enjoy lunch at a local pagoda prepared by our private chef. • Visit a colorful Cao Dai Temple. • Depart Mekong Delta for Saigon. • Arrive back at Saigon’s central pier. Les Rives staff will take you back to your hotel by car.
strTitle: Travel the Mekong Delta by speedboat

strIntroduction: Welcome to Nha Trang! I wish to be your guide to take you out for a photography day tour around Nha Trang. On this excursion, you can experience and peek into the local people's daily lives. I will take you to sights and places you will never find or discover on your own. This is a very offbeat tour of the region I have grown up in and love. The photographs we will take together will be something you will keep as a memory for life. Through my lens, you will sense the humanity, compassion and spirit of the Vietnamese. We always respect the subjects we shoot. Come with an open mind and heart, you will have much to reflect on afterwards. If you are a photography enthusiast, you are more than welcome to use your own camera - if not - we can use mine and the photos will still be yours. Meet up location: At your hotel in Nha Trang or if you are arriving on a cruise ship, I will meet you just outside the port at the Oceanographic Institute, 150m away. End location: Back to your cruise ship or your hotel
strTitle: Capture Real Vietnam with an Award-Winning Photographer

strIntroduction: Explore the intriguing stretch of railway running between Hanoi and Long Bien Stations - and directly across the city - on this unique afternoon tour. We capture the astonishing variety of life on the tracks, from railway workers and trains to the houses and markets all the way along the line, while focusing on key points of photographic composition. Passing trains and various light requirements, as well as the traffic that rushes between each section of the line, give us the opportunity to look at important technical points such as ISO settings and Shutter Priority mode, while our journey along the tracks and encounter with the locals means a chance to pick up some professional photojournalism tips on building a story and photographing people. Meeting Location - This tour begins on the steps outside Hanoi Railway Station, Le Duan Street. Time - 2:30 to 6:30pm
strTitle: Discover and Photograph Life on Hanoi's Train Tracks

strIntroduction: This tour is a part night excursion, part street/local food adventure. Guests experience the nightlife of Saigon the way locals do, all from the back of a vintage Vespa scooter. Stops include drinks at Zoom cafe to watch "the world goes by" (as said in the Lonely Planet guide book), food and drinks at local restaurants (one stop for sea food and one stop for Southern food), samplings of Saigon's best authentic street/local food, a Vietnamese-style coffee shop (with live music) and wrapping up the evening at one of the many local nightclubs (with live music) , where the new generation of Vietnamese unwind and flaunt their unique style. Guests will enjoy and experience the Vietnamese night life with friends.... It's definitely a look at Saigon the way the residents live it -- nothing you'll find in a guidebook. All food and drinks for the evening are included in the tour. The tour runs from 18:00-22:30 pm nightly.
strTitle: Ride and Eat Through Saigon After Dark (On Vintage Vespa)

strIntroduction: The Mekong River flows through 6 countries, starting from China and continuing down to Myanmar Thailand, Laos, Cambodia and finally Vietnam. The Mekong River builds up a populous and rich delta for Vietnam, which may explain why people from the South are the friendliest and most generous! This is a private day tour for your group only. Itinerary: I will pick you up from your hotel in Ho Chi Minh City and bring you to Tien Giang. -We will take a boat ride that will bring you to My Tho fish market and four beautiful islands Long, Lan, Qui, and Phung. -Stopover at a local's house on Thoi Son Island to enjoy honey tea and fresh fruits while listening to a traditional music performance of “Tai Tu” - the lovely and romantic melody of one of the tribes in Mekong Delta. -Row on sampans (small boats) along the canals of Mekong River. -Explore a small village by riding horse drawn carriage, then visit a hand-made coconut candy house. -Lunch will be served at Thoi Son restaurant. -Return to My Tho Pier -Go back to Ho Chi Minh City, visit Vinh Trang Pagoda or Chinatown I will drop you off at your hotel at the end of the day.
strTitle: Experience Daily Life in the Mekong Delta on a private tour

strIntroduction: We will enjoy Vietnamese food in the host family's house where we will introduce you to some traditional Vietnamese dishes while you experience the family culture at the dinner table. You will also learn how to cook these Vietnamese dishes by yourself. We will pick you up from your hotel and take you to the host. From there, you will be taken to the local market to buy fresh ingredients before heading back to the host's home to learn Vietnamese cooking and enjoy a delicious meal.
strTitle: Enjoy Vietnamese Food With A Local Family

strIntroduction: Our Insider's Tour of Saigon is a stylish, fantastic way to get a view of Saigon that few visitors see on a Vintage Vespa. We get well off the beaten tourist track, but we also stop briefly at several of the more popular District 1 sights, including the People's Committee Building, Reunification Palace, Notre Dame Cathedral and the historic Post Office. Our Vespa tour of modern-day Ho Chi Minh City will give you a view of Saigon unlike anything you'll see from a package tour, and much more of the city than you could see on your own. We're longtime residents of Saigon, and we know exactly how to take in the must-see landmarks while also getting you off the crowded tourist trail for a peek at the history, the streets and the sights that most visitors never even hear about or see. All guests ride pillion behind our drivers. The tour runs from 08:00-12:30 & 12:00-16:30
strTitle: The Insider's Tour of Saigon (on Vintage Vespa)

strIntroduction: Start Ho Chi Minh City at 8:00am to HCM Agricultural Villages 8:45am Visiting HCM Agricultural Villages from 8:45am – 10:00am + Visiting cow areas + Visiting buffalo areas + Visiting rice fields + Visiting fish, prawn, chicken, duck areas + Visiting big herbs, spices, vegetables and mushrooms areas + Become a real Vietnamese Farmer for a day by donning on Vietnamese Traditional Hat and harvest herbs ,spices ,vegetables and mushrooms from the garden Cooking class + Hands on cooking class with three dishes and 1 dessert and enjoy what they have done + Enjoy Great Healthy Cooking Tips + Leave with nice certificate, recipes, souvenirs + Collect email and receive updates of nice healthy recipes monthly Visit Cu Chi Tunnels + Watching a presentation video + Getting to see the tunnels and discover how these tunnels were constructed and how its inhabitants combat two forces: the invading troops and the tunnels itself. + Visiting Hoang Cam's smoke-less store, secret hide-outs, fighting bunkers, and many dangerous booby traps. + Trying gun shooting with real bullets (fees not included) + Tasting boiled tapioca, drinking hot tea The trip will end at 5:00pm, and guests will be sent back to their hotels in HCM City. Join this tour to enjoy great, unique experiences about Vietnamese culture, cuisine and history!
strTitle: Take a cooking class and visit the Cu Chi Tunnels

strIntroduction: On this tour, our expert, local guides take you where no other tours will. It's a scenic adventure that goes beyond the concrete jungle of Saigon and onto the back roads and red dirt trails of the Delta countryside. You will cross dozens of bridges over many river tributaries, ride on a river ferryboat, cruise through a vibrant bustling riverside market, tour local cottage industries and sample some Vietnamese specialties (food and drinks). You will feel a world away from the city on this off-road ride. This tour requires an adventurous spirit and a strong backside. Experienced and skilled riders can drive their own Vespa or automatic scooter, or you can enjoy the beautiful countryside scenery from the back of a restored classic Vespa. We end at a restaurant where you can cast a line and catch a fish while you enjoy a cold beer in the shade. This tour runs from 08:00-14:30
strTitle: Take a Glimpse of the Mighty Mekong (On Vintage Vespa)

strIntroduction: VietFood Tours has been regarded the best service of our tours so far. The tour have been getting a lot of satistfies from all customer who want to spend whole night to explore the famous and local areas of the city, and taste most of famous Vietnamese foods from local restaurants instead of luxury restaurants. With Vietfood Tours you will see the best of Viet Nam, have overviews of Vietnames people and their daily lives and learn more about Vietnamese cuisines with the best price compared with other motorbike tours. Specially, you could own time for each place without rushing and being pushed for the next places. The time can not bother us, we only care how to make your tour done perfectly!
strTitle: Explore Saigon by motorbike: Palaces to delicious food

strIntroduction: This private city day tour will take you through the most exotic and interesting sights of Vietnam's friendly and bustling streets. You will enjoy observing the daily life of local people hurrying around on crowded bicycles and motorbikes cutting through red lights. You will see the vendors displaying their goods on the streets. You will learn why drivers honk their horns all the time, why we are at the top of the happiness index despite being a developing country. You will see how different Vietnam is from any city you have ever been to because at the core of all the hustle and bustle are the warm hearts of the local Vietnamese people. Itinerary: Start at the Reunification Palace, which is now preserved as a museum. The underground communications bunkers in the palace was used as the Saigon Government headquarters during the American War. We will also visit Notre Dame Cathedral & the Post office nearby. We continue our trip on to the teeming Ben Thanh Market where anything and everything is negotiable and for sale. Lunch will be local Vietnamese food. After lunch, we will visit Cho Lon, the city’s Chinatown and a reminder of the long history of Chinese influence on Vietnam. Cho Lon is bustling all day and night, adding to the charm of the city. Walk down the hundreds of small alleyways where locals buy and sell a huge variety of items. Stop at Thien Hau pagoda for some photos. We will end the tour with a visit to a lacquerware workshop - a most famous handi-craft product in Vietnam, then a War Remnant Museum, before we send you back your hotel. We hope you will enjoy this culturally enriching experience.
strTitle: Explore the Messy, Amazing side of Saigon on a Private Tour

strIntroduction: Get a glimpse of the Mekong and experience the culture of this fascinating country by taking our most popular tour - “A Glimpse of the Mekong with Cooking Class”. This is a great opportunity for you to see, hear, taste, and experience the authentic lifestyle of the Mekong. Feel the real Mekong by crossing dozens of bridges over many river tributaries, ride on a river ferryboat, cruise through a vibrant bustling riverside market. We will walk through the market with our chef and interact with the locals to buy ingredients which are part of the authentic Vietnamese dishes that guests experience in the cooking class. The cooking menu and recipes are easy and fun for everyone. You will want to share them with friends and family when coming back home. You will feel a world away from the city on this off-road ride and a ‘YAY, I can cook’. This activity runs from 08:00-14:30.
strTitle: A Glimpse of the Mekong with Cooking Class (On a Vespa)

strIntroduction: Vietnam has more than 100 kinds of noodle. In this afternoon tour, you’ll have a chance to taste 5 special kinds of noodle in the hidden alleys. We'll start the tour with Chicken Vermicelli and iced tea to give us energy for the rest of our adventure. We’ll explore our first alley, containing one of the oldest noodle places in Ho Chi Minh City. (45mins) After the first alley, we’ll take a walk to the second alley, where you’ll have the second dish named Bun Rieu Oc - another kind of noodle with crab meat and snail. (30mins) For a little break between alleys, we’ll stop by a local market for a smoothie and snacks. (30 mins) Next alley, we’ll have a taste of Hue (Bun Bo Hue - beef noodle) and special bean tea. A classic flavor from the people of Hue. (45mins) Finally at the last alley, we’ll taste a special noodle from the Mekong delta - Hu Tiu My Tho. Here we’ll end our tour.
strTitle: Noodle Journey - Alley Adventure

strIntroduction: Cycle into the Sapa valley and experience the fantastic scenery of mountains and rice paddy fields along the way. You will visit the Black Hmong village of Su Pan and then continue mostly downhill to the Tay village of Ban Ho, where you will enjoy lunch and have time to explore the village and take a swim in the river. After lunch you will be able to take a walk up to the Red Dao village of Nam Toong. Here you will have time to visit the local school and a Red Dao house. After exploring Nam Toong we will walk back to Ban Ho where a car will be waiting to take you back to Sapa.
strTitle: Ride through the mountains and rice fields of Sapa Valley

strIntroduction: This is a fascinating trip meandering from the hilly highlands down to one of the nicest beaches in the world. Cycling is the best way to feel the local life. For all level bikers. Brief Itinerary (B: Breakfast, L: Lunch, D: Dinner): Day 1: Da Lat city (50km+ cycling) (L) This ride probably offers the best sampling of single-track downhill riding in the Dalat area. The total ride distance is about 50 kilometers and it is the easiest of our rides. Views are outstanding throughout with beautiful pine forested hills and picturesque small farms dotting the valleys you will ride through. This excursion takes you to visit a selection of the numerous attractions in Da Lat City, such as Crazy House, King Bao Dai's Summer Palace, Lam Ty Ni pagoda, valley of love, Da Lat Flower garden, Valley of Love, Langbiang view, Railway Station and around Xuan Huong lake. Day 2: Da Lat - Nha Trang (90km+ cycling) (B,L) The bike ride starts from the Dalat hotel, cycling on undulating roads with lush pine tree forests along the way. The temperature will change from Da Lat at 1500m altitude to the sea. We will have a picnic lunch. Then we will ride the rest way to reach the highway 1, and transfer to the hotel in Nhatrang. If time permits, we will visit the Cham tower Ponagar and stay overnight at one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, Nha Trang. Day3: Nha Trang (boating) (B,L) Morning boat trip to Tri Nguyen Aquarium, then to Hon Mun island for snorkeling to see the coral reef and ocean life. We will have lunch at a Lang Chai islet (fishing village) restaurant. Boat back and finish the tour.
strTitle: Cycle & boat in Vietnam's Countryside: Da Lat & Nha Trang

strIntroduction: This trip is not only a boat trip along rice paddies, where one can enjoy the breath taking scenery of the Vietnamese countryside, but also an incredible bicycle ride along a hidden road through the “Halong in Land”. Brief Itinerary: Transfer out of Ha Noi to Hoa Lu (2.5 hrs). Visit the historic capital of Viet Nam and the famous ancient temples of Le and The Dinh Dynasties. Cycle for an hour on picturesque quiet roads through villages, rice fields, rivers and rocky outcrops to Tam Coc for lunch. We will then cycle on a country road taking us to Sunny Wharf, a small dock, for a sampan boat journey into the heart of “Inland Ha Long Bay”. Take in the beauty of the karst formations as you pass along their base and row into one of the many caves carved through the limestone. Stop for a short rest near a small shrine before returning to the boat and making your way back to the dock. Cycle back to Tam Coc village. Drive back to Ha Noi. (Lunch included)
strTitle: Bike and boat through Hanoi's breathtaking countryside

strIntroduction: Mai Chau is one of the most popular places for off-road cycling in Northern Vietnam. This trip to the Northwest highland of Mai Chau offers a balance of cultural and physical activity set amongst some of Northern Vietnam’s stunning natural landscape. We will ride approximately 100 km, mostly on off-road tracks, that vary from hard packed jeep roads to single-track. It is suitable for people who are fit, have off-road experience, and enjoy a mountain bike challenge in a beautiful environment. Brief Itinerary (B: Breakfast, L: Lunch): Day 1: Hanoi - Mai Chau (50km cycling) (L) Transfer out of Hanoi city to Luong Son - picturesque landscapes. Stop to visit the Thay pagoda and cycle to Mai chau village. Lunch at a local restaurant. Arrive at Mai Chau and stay overnight in a Thai person’s home. Day 2: Mai Chau and surroundings (50km cycling) (B,L) After breakfast, ride to visit the morning foggy scenery of the beautiful west region of Vietnam, and do some trekking along the trails. Have a picnic lunch. Back to the home where we stayed for checking out and leave for Ha Noi. End of tour.
strTitle: Experience off-road cycling in Northern Vietnam

strIntroduction: The ancient architecture of Hoi An is a fascinating combination of Vietnamese traditional characters with Chinese and Japanese influence. There is plenty to see in this delightful and tranquil town, some of which are the famous Japanese Covered Bridges, the Pottery Museum, the 200-year-old Tam Ky House, the Chua Ong Pagoda, and the vibrant market. Bike between two of Vietnam’s most impressive and internationally recognized World Heritage sites. This beautiful ride takes you along China Coast, over the spectacular Hai Van pass, and meanders through small fishing villages, lagoons, rice paddies and forests. Brief Itinerary (B: Breakfast, L: Lunch, D:Dinner): Day 1: Hue - Da Nang (60km+ cycling) (L) Pick up from your hotel in Hue, transfer out of Hue city. The bike ride starts from Thuan An beach to Cau Hai lagoon where you can see many fishermen on their boat and stilt houses. Lunch will be a picnic at a local restaurant on the way. Keep riding to Lang Co beach before cycling up to the scenic Pass in Vietnam Hai Van with a beautiful view from the top of the hill. We will then cycle along the coast to the hotel and stay overnight in Da Nang. Day 2: Da Nang - Hoi An (45km+ cycling) (B,L) We will visit the Cham museum in the city in the morning, then cycle out of Da Nang city to Marble Mountain where we will visit the Stone sculpture factory (products from marble and sandstone). Then we will keep biking to Hoi An, an ancient town. Lunch in Hoi An. In the afternoon, we will ride to Thanh Ha pottery village and from village to village through green rice fields. Overnight in Hoi An. Day 3: Hoi An – My Son (30km+ cyling) (B,L) Morning ride to My Son world heritage site where we can admire the peak culture of the Cham people during the 4th to the 13th century. Visit the sites and cycle the backroads to reach highway 1, transfer to Hoi An. The whole afternoon will be free to relax on the beach and explore ancient Hoi An. There will be time for buying silk and other shopping. Overnight in Hoi An. Day4: Depart Hoi An (no cycling) (B) Have breakfast at the hotel. Join a cooking Class for half the day (optional). End of tour.
strTitle: Bike across spectacular Vietnam: Hue to Hoi An

strIntroduction: Northwest Vietnam offers travelers some of the most spectacular scenery. The mountainous areas are also home to many distinct hill tribes such as Black Thai, Dao, Mong. This trip will give you a chance to contemplate magnificent mountains covered with thick rain forest, lush plantation, wild nature and friendly people from different ethnic minority groups with their colorful and fantastic culture and customs... Brief Itinerary (B: Breakfast, L: Lunch, D:Dinner) Day 1: Arrive Ha Noi - Overnight train to Lao Cai (D) Airport transfer to the capital city of Ha Noi, where you can explore the old city on your own and meet at the hotel for trip briefing. Our van will drive you to the train station for catching a train at 9:00 pm to Lao Cai. We will stay overnight on a travel train. Day 2: Sapa - Supan Valley afternoon ride (20km cycling) (B,L) Arrive at Lao Cai early in the morning, transfer to Sapa for breakfast, have a short rest and take some time to fit the bikes before riding into the Sapa Valley. Overnight in Sapa. Day 3: Sapa - Ta Phin Loop ride full day (30km cycling) (B,L) Cycle an off road track to the village of Ta Phin, where the ride will be more challenging in a loop across steep and forested hillsides and minority villages. Overnight in Sapa. Day 4: Sapa – Tam Duong (Phong Tho) – Pa So (80km cycling) (B,L) Cycle shortly uphill as a warm up to the Tram Ton Pass, before starting a long descent ride to Binh Lu. Ride a truly off the beaten track (jeep track) mixed of hard pack gravel and clay to Tam Duong and Pa So. Stay overnight in Pa So. Day5: Pa So – Sin Ho - Lai Chau (now Muong Lay) (45km cycling) (B,L) Take a brutal ride this day to Lai Chau and Sin Ho and get a reward of truly spectacular views. The ride is on the main road, uphill and tarmac downhill, mixed of gravel and hard pack clay. Stay overnight in Lai Chau. Day6: Lai Chau – Tuan Giao - Dien Bien Phu (90km cycling) (B,L) We will have the hardest and most challenging ride this day to Tuan Giao and Dien Bien Phu, on a rough tarmac terrain all the way, but you will be rewarded with stunningly beautiful scenery and untouched remote villages. Overnight in Dien Bien Phu. Day7: Dien Bien Phu – Hanoi (no cycling) (B,L) Take a half morning tour exploring the historical sites of Dien Bien Phu. Late morning flight to Hanoi and transfer into town. End of tour.
strTitle: Bike for a week from Hanoi to Dien Bien Phu

strIntroduction: Take this trip to explore The North of Indochina on bike. This is an adventurous, on-moving tour through the mountainous Northwest provinces of Vietnam and Laos. This tour is suitable for fit, experienced cycling enthusiasts. Brief Itinerary (B: Breakfast, L: Lunch, D: Dinner): Day 1: Hanoi arrival Welcome to Hanoi. Our guide will be at the airport to pick you up. Transfer to the hotel. Check in and have a welcome dinner at the local restaurant. Overnight in Hanoi. Day 2: Hanoi city tour (B,L) Leave the hotel to visit Ngoc Son temple, Hanoi Old Quarters, pass by Dong Xuan market then continue to the Old Citadel. Stop for visiting Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Museum, One Pillar Pagoda. Continue to visit the Quan Thanh Temple and Tran Quoc Pagoda. After lunch proceed to visit the Ethnology Museum, continue to visit the Literature Temple and Quoc Tu Giam. There will be an evening water puppet show. Overnight in Hanoi. Day 3: Hanoi - Overnight train to Lao Cai (B) We will have a free day in Hanoi, an afternoon brief walking tour to explore Hanoi and in the evening we will have a trip briefing. We will spend the night on a train heading towards Lao Cai. Lao Cai is on the gateways to China. Lao Cai lies at the end of the train line on the Chinese border. The border crossing slammed shut during the 1979 war between China and Vietnam and remained closed until 1993. Lao Cai is now a major hub for travellers journeying between Hanoi, Sapa (38km away) and Kunming. Day 4: Sapa (20km cycling) (B,L) Transfer to Sapa up the mountainside and have time to get the bikes ready to go before biking into the Sapa Valley. The Queen of Mountains, Sapa sits regally overlooking a beautiful valley, lofty mountains towering over the town on all sides. Sapa is a French hill station that was built in 1922. Stay overnight in Sapa. Day5: Sapa ride full day (30km cycling) (B,L) Cycling an off road track to the village of Ta Phin, when the ride will be more challenging in a loop across steep and forested hillsides and minority villages. Stay overnight in Sapa. Day6: Sapa – Tam Duong (Phong Tho) – Pa So (80km cycling) (B,L,D) Cycling shortly uphill as a warm up to the Tram Ton Pass, before starting a long descent ride to Binh Lu and ride on a truly off the beaten track (jeep track) mixed of hard pack gravel and clay to Tam Duong and Pa So. Overnight in Pa So – Lai Chau. Day7:Pa So – Sin Ho - Lai Chau (now Muong Lay) (45km cycling) (B,L) Take a brutal ride this day to Lai Chau and Sin Ho and get a reward of truly spectacular views. The ride is on the main road, uphill and tarmac downhill, mixed of gravel and hard pack clay. Overnight in Lai Chau. Day8: Lai Chau (Muong Lay) – Tuan Giao - Dien Bien Phu (90km cycling) (B,L) We will go on the hardest and most challenging ride on this day to Tuan Giao and Dien Bien Phu, on a rough tarmac terrain all the way, but you will be rewarded with the stunningly beautiful scenery and untouched remote villages. Overnight in Dien Bien Phu. Day9: Dien Bien Phu – Muang Khua (70km cycling) (B,L) Early in the morning we will explore the historical sites of Dien Bien Phu. It used to be the big battlefield between the French and Vietnamese when Vietnam fought again the French to get independence. Then we cycle 70km to Muang Khau by crossing Laos North-East border at Tay Tran. This Northeast area is the area with the least amount of people of Laos. In the afternoon, we will continue cycling to Muang Khua along Nam Ou river. Overnight in Muang Khua. Day10: Muang Khua to Oudomxai (75km cycling) (B,L) After breakfast, we will cycle 75km on the main road to Oudomxai. This is a scenic lightly traveled road to bustling Oudomxai. During the second Indochina War, the provincial capital became the center for Chinese troops supporting Pathet Laos. Today, it is the junction of National Road 1, 2 and 4 which has made it a booming also - China trade center. Day11: Oudomxai to Pak Mong (60km cycling) (B,L) After breakfast, we fill up our water supply and then do a bit of exercise to warm up our muscles. We will begin to cycle with a tough climb with hill after hill but the scenery is magnificent. Then we will take a break to enjoy snacks, fresh fruits and drinks to get energy before continuing to cycle to Pak Mong. Overnight in Pak Mong. Day12: Pak Mong to Luang Prabang (95km cycling) (B,L) Today is our longest bike ride. Early morning, we cycle on the main road passing Ban Thabu. Then we cycle along Nam Ou river. It is interesting to cycle along the river through villages and get a chance to see their rural lives. Enjoy picnic lunch on the riverbank and take a power nap before heading to Pak Ou. It has the famous tourist attraction, Pak Ou caves. The end of the day, we finally arrive at Luang Prabang, the World Heritage town. Dinner and overnight in Luang Prabang. Day13: Luang Prabang (50km biking) (B,L) After breakfast, we set off south of Luang Prabang, enjoying splendid mountains and unspoiled forest scenery. Upon reaching the river, we will take a small long tail motor taxi downstream on the Nam Khan River, passing stunning soft green mountains and observing the local activities at various small villages on our way. Your bike will be ready at the local pier near Ban Phanom for our journey back to Luang Prabang. We will take an alternative route back to Luang Prabang, riding through and stopping over at the well-known weaving village of Tai Lue, who used to make silk weaving textiles for the former Lao royal family. We will then ride to Luang Prabang by the late evening, to enjoy a short guided cycling tour in Luang Prabang before sunset. Day14: Luang Prabang (42km biking) (B,L) An early call wake-up call will invite you to participate in giving alms to the Buddhist monks as the sun rises. Then, we will head northbound from Luang Prabang to the village of Ban Pak Ou. After enjoying a picnic lunch surrounded by the picturesque countryside, we will cross the Mekong River to Pak Ou and the Thamting Caves, located on the Mekong riverbank. Day15: Luang Prabang departure(B) After breakfast this morning, we will visit The National Museum at the former Royal Palace, which displays a lovely collection of the artifacts reflecting the richness of Lao culture dating from the days of the early kings right through to the last sovereign. We also visit the Phousi Market, where you will see such diverse goods such as dried buffalo skin, local tea and saltpeter in addition to the chickens, vegetables and hill-tribe weaving. The tour ends here. If you have an onward flight, we'd be happy to transfer you to the airport.
strTitle: Bike through the mountains from Vietnam to Laos

strIntroduction: Have you heard about how busy and heavy the traffic in Saigon can be? It's a good excuse to discover the real rural countryside by bike. Come, join and experience it in a half day trip. You will be picked up at your hotel, and taken out of the busy city to a riding point. We will ride through villages and local markets on both paved and dirt roads. We will stop at cafes and chat to people on the way. We will have a relaxing day of riding around the countryside and discovering the Vietnamese lifestyle. The ride will be approximately 20-35km in a half day. This will be the perfect way to get close to real Vietnamese life for business people or first time visitors.
strTitle: Bike through Saigon's countryside

strIntroduction: Learn the Secrets of Local Cuisine with our English-speaking Vietnamese Chef! Market visit from 8:45 am to 9:40 am Our Vietnamese Chef will guide you through the colorful and vibrant Ben Thanh market to purchase the ingredients you will use with him during the cooking class lesson. Feel free to ask any questions you want! At 9:40 am our Chef will bring you back by taxi (included) to our cooking class. Hands-on cooking class from 10:00 am to 1:00 pm You will use Vietnamese kitchenware to create and enjoy a tasty 3 courses Vietnamese meal. To end on a sweet touch, we will complete this meal with a delicious seasonal dessert. During the class you will focus on the pleasure of discovering and enjoying the cooking, and we'll give you all the detailed recipes at the end. Of course we will adapt the menu to vegetarians or people with food allergies, so please let us know your booking in advance so we can accommodate for you. Kids from 7 years old are welcome.
strTitle: Learn the secret of Vietnamese local cuisine

strIntroduction: Hop on the back of our motorbike and let our team drive you first to a vibrant local market to discover exotic ingredients. This fascinating introduction is essential to understand what you will enjoy later on your plate. You will then visit with us our favorite’s street vendors in district 3, 10 and 5 to savor Vietnamese delicacies while discovering local life and charming sites. As its physically impossible to eat everything on offer, let your guide advise you well through a thrilling journey across Saigon's small alleys! Schedule: 8am till 12pm, Tuesday till Sunday. Group size: 1 to 6pax.
strTitle: Saigon Street Food Secrets Motorbike Tour

strIntroduction: A romantic landscape, private space, impressive style…these are the lasting impressions after you enjoy our therapy method at our spa. We have 14 relaxing rooms offering therapy methods like mud soaking in a wooden tub, and warm water soaking in marble tub. - First, take a Sauna and Steambath to loosen your muscles. - Do some light exercise in our warm mineral water pool, or enjoy a Jacuzzi, these activities help the minerals percolate your muscles and joint. - Next, soak in warm mineral-mud and natural warm mineral water which will make your skin soft, bright and relaxed. - Finally, feel relaxed and refreshed with a 95min body massage with attar, fresh milk, and bee’s honey. Feel the heat of herbal attar throughout your entire body. - You will be served snacks, fruits, tea or coffee, jam, mineral water. A swimsuit and towel will be provided. - After you finish your bath and massage, you can go to the salon for a shampoo, face massage, or manicure. - Choose a souvenir at the end of the day, before our private care takes you back to your hotel in the center of Nha Trang city Other optional services available: - Herbal Bath Therapy Add a bag of herbs to rest on your shoulders, neck and head while you soak in your warm mineral water bath. This will help you relax, release aches, and improve health. - Foot massage Your feet are a vital part of your body, there are about 7,000 nerves under every sole. Let our skilled feet masseuse massage your tired travelers feet for 60min.
strTitle: Soak in a Mud Bath and Treat Yourself to a Spa

strIntroduction: Saigon, Vietnam's economic hub, is reputable for its hectic daily life and sparkling nightlife that is popular amongst the younger generation. Explore Saigon at night on this night tour to see the back alleys and best attractions in Saigon. I will bring you to hidden locations that only locals know, as well as the best spots for photo taking. I will also introduce you to all sorts of yummy street food and coffee houses serving creative beverages where we can have drinks and chat about life as a local in Vietnam. To top it all off, we will travel everywhere on a motorbike! Come join me on this exhilarating bike tour of Saigon!
strTitle: Go on an Exhilarating Private Tour of Saigon at Night

strIntroduction: Get away from the classical cooking classes and learn the beauty of cooking Vietnamese cuisine from a cozy local home. We will start our day with a short stop at a local market. There, you will buy all the ingredients needed: vegetables, spices, meat, fish, etc. After providing you more information about the different kinds of ingredients you can find in Vietnam, we will then go to one of the local homes where our host will teach you the different cooking styles of a typical Vietnamese menu. End the day feasting on the fruits of your labour - delicious home-cooked Vietnamese dishes!
strTitle: Learn to Cook Vietnamese Food in a Local Home

strIntroduction: In this day tour, I will bring you to visit a weasel coffee farm as well as the XQ Historical Village. Weasel Coffee Farm Coffee ferret or weasel coffee division is the name of a special kind of coffee, classified as the rarest beverage in the world. Quality coffee beans actually come from passing through the stomach of these civet species, resulting in a purer coffee flavor. These coffee beans are fleshier and contain the subtle smell of smoke and chocolate. Watch and be amazed as the weasels in the farm make coffee for you. XQ Historical Village The XQ Historical Village is an abbreviation of two artists who founded the village - Vo Van Quan and Hoang Le Xuan. Laid out like an art gallery, the many artworks on display which appear like paintings are actually hand embroidered works of art, stitched by artists on site. The tour will cover many different areas, including: -Embroidery exhibition areas -Food court -Embroidery area -Embroidery artisans honor area -Flower garden and art installation -Showroom for the history of embroidery Enjoy Vietnamese street food for lunch and dinner.
strTitle: Watch Weasels Make Coffee for You

strIntroduction: In this half day tour, I will bring you by motorbike to different parts of rural Vietnam, Da Lat, to see the locals as well as wildlife in their natural habitat, such as the endangered slow loris. We will also take a Jeep up to Langbiang Mountain. -Van Thanh Flower Farm With over 100 hectares of arable land, the soil is this flower farm is suitable for all types of flowers. The Van flower village is famous not only for its high quality display of flowers, but also its flower center, which is the largest provider of Lam Dong flowers for local flower market. -Golden Lake Golden Valley has pine forests with tall pines ranging from 5-15m. Diverse array of vegetation can be found on this mountainous terrain such as mimosas and hydrangeas. The most unique part of Golden Valley is its garden, which features cleverly arranged art. Point makes a difference for Golden Valley is the garden with cleverly arranged art. -Ankroet Hydropower plant In 1967, The Ralph M. Company Parsons in Los Angeles (USA) did a study on the water supply problem in Da Lat. The report mentioned a project to build a water plant in Yellow Springs. The capacity of the plant detailed in this project is 25.000m3 of water/day, with a 24m diameter water pipeline running from the plant to the water tank on the hill Tung Lam (Thouard). -Culan Village The Culan Village has been around since the 20th century. The ethnic K'ho people living in this rustic village commonly engage in farming, hunting and gathering as a profession. Old trees in the highlands are chopped down and processed for tourists and for medicinal purposes. This has resulted in the loss of natural habitat for the slow loris (or Culan, as the locals call it). Additionally, the K'ho people also 'pick-up' the cutest slow lorises or the ones with the most beautiful big eyes to bring back to the village as livestock, to be sold to tourists as pets or souvenirs. These old and gentle animals are primarily nocturnal. See them up close, watch how they curl back with both hands covering their precious eyes when meeting with danger. Its such a tragedy when they are just 'picked' and taken away from their families in a basket. -Mount Langbiang Langbiang, or Langbiang mountain, comprises two mountains: Mount Mr. and Mrs. mountains. Located at an altitude of 2,167 m above sea level, Langbiang is also referred to as the "roof" of Da Lat, and is an iconic attraction here.
strTitle: See the Slow Loris in its Natural Habitat - Rural Da Lat

strIntroduction: On this tour, I'll take you through the city of eternal spring in Vietnam, the city of Da Lat. We'll visit the main attractions as well as offbeat, local areas to see the true side of this charming, hillside town. The following is just a brief description of our day together. 1) Da Lat Cathedral Da Lat Cathedral is a cathedral for the Catholics in Vietnam, known as Con Ga church for its bell-shaped tower and french-style architecture. It is also the largest church in Da Lat. 2) Crazy House Since launching in 1990, this building has been recognized for its unique architecture and has been highlighted in guide books as one of the 10 most bizarre buildings as voted by the People Journal of China. 3) The Old Railway Station Da Lat Railway Station is considered the oldest railway station in Vietnam and Indochina. The station was built by the French in 1932 to 1938, spanning 84km long from Da Lat to Phan Rang. The station has a unique architectural style, you can recognize it by its three pyramidal roofs which resembles Langbiang mountain. 4) Lycee Yersin School The Pedagogical College of Da Lat (formerly called the Grand Lycee Yersin) is known as having one of the most unique architecture in the world in the 20th century by the architectural world Association of Architects (UIA). 5) Flower Garden For a long time, Da Lat has been known as the land of a thousand flowers. Da Lat Flower Garden, located near Xuan Huong Lake, is home to hundreds of thousands of lovely flowers. 6) XQ Historical Village XQ Historical Village is an abbreviation of two artists who founded the village - Vo Van Quan and Hoang Le Xuan. Laid out like an art gallery, the many artworks on display which appear like paintings are actually hand embroidered works of art, stitched by artists on site. The tour will cover many different areas, including: -Embroidery exhibition areas -Food court -Embroidery area -Embroidery artisans honor area -Flower garden and art installation -Showroom for the history of embroidery 7) Bao Dai's Summer Palace Built as a summer retreat for the last emperor of Vietnam in 1930s, Bao Dai's Summer Palace is now preserved as a special art-deco architecture building with a museum.
strTitle: Explore Unique Architecture in Charming Da Lat

strIntroduction: Discover the wonders and mysteries of Da Lat's nature with a one day Water Abseiling & Canyoning trip at Datania Falls. Discover the fantastic canyons and the challenges of the incredible forges as yo walk, jump and swim through nature's obstacles. Here is the itinerary for the day: -8:30 pick up at hotel and depart to Datanla falls. -Arrive at the practical abseiling point, learn how to use the equipment (45min) -Enjoy your first dry abseiling by rappelling from 18m height. -Do a second dry abseil with a rappel of 15m. -Free swim at the waterfall. -Join water sliding. -Picnic lunch (baguette, cheese, fruits, vegetables, jam, water, etc…) -Get the real canyoning experience from the 25m high waterfall. -Free jump from around 5 to 10m height. -Attempt the last and most difficult rappel (16m height). -Trek for 20min up a hill to the van that will bring you back to your hotel End the trip.
strTitle: Explore Wild Da Lat through Canyoning & Abseiling

strIntroduction: Enjoy the natural landscapes in Vietnam's countryside, go on an eco-adventure day tour around Dalat and see a side of the country where people and nature coexist in harmony. Here are some highlights of the trip: -Visit local flower and strawberry farms. Take a walk along the mountain ranges, enjoy the view and observe how the people care for the flowers and harvest strawberries -Visit coffee plantations, enjoy local coffee -Visit a specialized silk factory. See how cocoons are bred, and the techniques of dying textile cloths. Watch the locals intricately embroider pictures by hand. Dare yourself to taste fried silkworm. -Visit Elephant Waterfall and Linh An Pagoda where the Big Happy Buddha lies Look forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Go on an Eco-adventure Day Tour Around Dalat with a Local

strIntroduction: The battle at Long Tan is the most famous battle fought by the Australian Army during the Vietnam War. The tour will begin with a departure for Ba Ria - Vung Tau Province by minivan. I will take you to the former Long Tan Battlefield where you will visit the former 1st Australian Task Force at Nui Dat. In a somber moment, we will visit the Australian Memorial established at Long Tan for the 17 Australian Infantrymen and one APC crewman killed in action during the Battle of Long Tan on August 18, 1966. After we recognize the valiant acts of the fallen soldiers from the battle of Long Tan, we will enjoy a delicious seafood lunch. Finally, we will ride back to Ho Chi Minh City.
strTitle: Learn the History of Long Tan Battlefield

strIntroduction: This is not for the faint of heart! I will take you to a local restaurant in a village a few kilometers away from the city of Dalat. You can experience the whole process of cooking a snake. This involves the chef slashing, skinning and cleaning the snake of its bacteria and/or venom. As well as cooking every part of the snake from its skin, to its meat and bones. The next part is voluntary - but you will be invited to eat the beating heart of the snake and gulping a shot of snake blood (mixed with vodka) just before the cooking process starts! If you do not wish to consume the snake, there are other local delicacies for you on the menu! This will be something you will keep in memory for a long, long time!
strTitle: Cook Snakes with a Local

strIntroduction: This is a 3 to 4 day motorbike tour, which includes overnight accommodation with local families. Day 1: Dalat – Lak lake: Before hitting the roads, we will visit the Crazy house, a picturesque hotel-museum in Dalat. Then we start our first day driving along the mountain paths, stopping along the way to visit local workshops such as a mushroom farm, and a silk factory. The Happy Buddha also awaits us with his big smile. After a mouth-watering lunch, we will drive along the Jungle way stopping over to see coffee plantations and the beautiful Elephant fall. From there, we drive directly to Lak Lake, staying overnight with a local family in a M’nong hill tribe typical longhouse. Day 2: Lak lake – Draysap and Draynu falls: Waking up in Lak lake is like taking a trip to the past. Take an early morning walk in the village to appreciate the local daily life, learn about their customs and culture. You also have the option to go for an elephant ride around the village (extra charge applies). Leaving Lak Lake, we are now on our way to Buon Me Thuot City, where we will have lunch and visit the local market before heading to Draysap waterfall, one of the highlights of Central highlands and the largest in the area. We will do a short trek in the jungle followed by a swim and natural spa in Gia Long fall. Overnight stay in a bungalow near the waterfalls or in a 2-star hotel in B.M.T city, your choice. Day 3: Draysap fall or B.M.T city – Nha Trang: Before starting our ride to Nha Trang, we will visit the hill tribe’s museum. After that, a scenic, beautiful drive along the mountain roads awaits us, stopping over to visit some of the E’de people villages. Then we slide down the amazing Phonenix pass to the coast and fishing village before ending our tour in Nha Trang.
strTitle: Motorbike through the Central Highlands - Dalat to Nha Trang

strIntroduction: Option 1: Standard Tour During this bike tour in Vietnam, you will learn about local life, local businesses, religious beliefs and family life in Vietnam. You will also have the opportunity to participate actively at each stop. Hoi An is a town famous for its arts and culture scene. We'll let you peek into the lives of local craftsman, artists, tailors and designers through an interactive story and hands-on experience. Take a break on our terrace overlooking Hoi An Ancient Town and the Thu Bon River, our NGO partner Streets International will provide healthy local snacks and drinks during your rest here. At the next stop, you will get to learn more about the local craft of pottery making and witness first-hand the skills and expertise of the local craftsmen. At the end of the tour, you can unwind in a stunning beach bar restaurant overlooking An Bang Beach. We will serve you a drink at the end of the morning tour, or a selection of cocktail at the end of the afternoon tour. You are free to use all the facilities in the restaurant (pool table, toilets, shower, day beds, lounge and beach towels). Option 2: Full Option Tour In this tour option, apart from peeking into their lives and unwinding at the beach, you will get to interact with the artists, tailors and designers who live in this town. You will also learn how to create and paint a bookmark on artisanal Vietnamese paper from a well-known local painter, or learn about the art of Hoi An Lantern making from our NGO partner Lifestart Foundation. You will receive a souvenir to take home at the end of the lesson. Additional meals and drinks will be available at the beach bar restaurant under this option.
strTitle: Feel the Charm of Hoi An on Asia's 1st Electric Scooter Tour

strIntroduction: This tour is a special tour introducing visitors from all over the world some specific characteristics relating to local cuisines and street food that you absolutely have to try on your trip to Saigon! The journey through the city will provide you an experience that is very close to the Saigonees as you enjoy your evening as they would. Your tour guide will pick up you by motorbike and give you a ride to where you can enjoy some simple foods. You will have an impressive overview of the transportation on the roads, especially during the time when school is out and work is completed. You will get to try many Vietnamese delicacies along the way. If you want, we can also take a walk around a local park to have a look at the aerobic classes where the people of the city are exercising and/or the kids are kicking in martial arts class. You might even be able to join them! To wrap your tour, we'll enjoy steamed or roasted shellfishes - one of Saigonees’ adored dishes.
strTitle: Go on a Foodie Tour Around the Hidden Streets of Saigon

strIntroduction: Saigon is a very frantic, hectic city and it can sometimes be hard to find peace and tranquility in this environment. To combat this, my boyfriend and I take spontaneous trips around the country whenever we get time. (Usually once a week on Sundays) This way we can revisit the true culture and beauty of Vietnam and recharge for the coming week ahead in the big city. We would personally love to invite you and join us on our trips so that you too can find something untouched, something hidden, something wild. We will usually take day-trips outside of Saigon. Our method until now has been very simple. Look at the map, point out a location that we haven't been to, and just ride our bikes there. However, we realize that at times there are specific things a traveler is looking for - so you can contact us in advance and let us know if there is something you prefer to see or experience. Waterfalls, Mountains, Temples, Pagodas, Street Food - whatever it is - we'll try our best to take you there - don't worry , we'll still be very much away from the tourist trail. Our bikes are - Honda Shadow 750CC Honda CD 125CC Honda Win 125CC You can ride pillion (sit on the back) with us, or if you prefer, we can arrange a bike for you to ride on your own too - providing you have valid documentation. (license) (Extra Surcharge) Some examples of where we have been recently 1. Mai Waterfall 2. Chua Chan Mountain 3. Buu Long (Mini- Ha Long Bay near Saigon) 4. Chau Doc - (Pagoda on a small island)
strTitle: Explore Wild Vietnam on a Spontaneous Motorbike Trip

strIntroduction: This photo tour takes you to Vietnam's mountainous and culturally unique northern frontier. We travel overnight by train to Lao Cai, and then by motorbike into the mountains for a traditional homestay with a H’mong family. The following day includes a trip by longboat up the Chay River, and a ride to Bac Ha town for the incredible Flower H’mong market. It all makes for an unforgettable adventure amidst spectacular surroundings. During this trip with us you will - Develop skills such as composition, portraiture and the use of various camera settings to enhance your photographs Capture the incredible visual variety of the villages, markets and landscapes of rural Vietnam Receive professional and group feedback throughout Participate in a maximum group size of 6 Enjoy a unique experience of Vietnam, gaining stunning pictures to prove it Tour leader Colm Pierce's photos have featured in numerous publications worldwide, including The Guardian (UK), LA Times (USA) and Le Figaro (France).
strTitle: Capture Vietnam's Beautiful North on a Unique Photo Tour

strIntroduction: Cruise the waters of Vietnam’s iconic Ha Long Bay while learning the fundamentals of great travel photography. We travel by chartered junk deep into the bay, far from the tourist hordes, and experience a side of Ha Long that most visitors barely glimpse. The trip includes a workshop on landscape photography from the top deck of our boat, a sampan or kayak excursion into the lagoons and caves surrounding Cat Ba National Park, and a dawn photoshoot at a floating village as fishermen start work for the day. Tour leader Colm Pierce's photos have featured in numerous publications worldwide, including The Guardian (UK), LA Times (USA) and Le Figaro (France).
strTitle: Discover Majestic Ha Long Bay with a Unique Photo Tour

strIntroduction: For those keen on a uniquely Hanoian adventure, join us before dawn at thriving Long Bien Market, as thousands of deliveries from the provinces and farther-flung regions of Vietnam provide the traders with stock. King Crab and Tuna from the East Sea rub shoulders with juicy apples and pumpkins from Dalat, and longans and lychees from the market gardens surrounding Hanoi. The early morning conditions allow us to focus on shooting in different lights, from night-time to sunrise, to after daybreak. The situation also allows us to work on naturalistic portraiture in environments of such hectic activity - a vital skill for anyone travelling in Asia. From century-old Long Bien Bridge overlooking the market we look at taking those classic photojournalistic establishing shots. Meeting Location - Tour begins under Long Bien Bridge, Yen Phu Street. Time - 4:30 am - 8:30 am
strTitle: Capture Hanoi's Long Bien Market at Dawn

strIntroduction: This classic tour visits both iconic locations and backstreet city secrets while focusing on the fundamentals of taking stunning travel photographs. Starting at colonial-era St Joseph's Cathedral, before moving onto historic Hoan Kiem Lake and the bustling backstreets of the Old Quarter, this is the best tour for anyone new to Hanoi and looking to improve their basic camera skills while enjoying an eye-opening introduction to the city. Meeting Location - Tour begins at No.2, Nha Chung Street, next to St. Joseph's Cathedral. Time - 8am to 12pm
strTitle: Encounter Hanoi's Old Quarter Through a Unique Photo Tour

strIntroduction: We will begin the evening with the best Wontan soup in town and some fresh coconut. Watch how the chef makes the soup, a traditional recipe passed down the family for 4 generations. (45mins) After the meal, we will energize ourselves before the walk with a local favourite dish Banh Mi Vit quay - Bread with Roasted duck. (15mins) Further down the road, we will stop for some cooling Chamomile tea and some lovely snacks (15 mins) Then we will sit down and enjoy some seafood only available in Vietnam, complemented with Vietnamese beer or tea. From here, we will take a taxi to another seafood paradise. We will end the day by chatting about Vietname culture over beer ☺ Join me and sample the best seafood from all over Vietnam.
strTitle: Learn About Vietnam's Culture Over Dinner

strIntroduction: This walking tour will last from 8am to 11am. We will start the day with “the most healthy Vietnamese pancake- Banh khot” and some Ice tea- Tra Da. It is called the most healthy pancake because it contains 5 different kinds of herbs. (45mins) After the pancake, we will walk to a famous local market nearby. Here, you can sample of the best Banh Mi in central Vietnam. You can also have a fresh coconut or a Nuoc Mia (sugarcane juice) while exploring the market. Some highlights that can be found in the market include Bo La Lot (Grilled beef sausage), an interesting Vietnamese dish. After that, we will have another break and sample some snacks (Banh nuong and Flan cake). (45mins) A little further down the road, we can have Vietnamese style Wonton soup ☺ (30mins) After all that feasting, we will walk to our last stop for some dessert to end the day- Coconut ice cream or special smoothie (your choice). (30mins).
strTitle: Discover Exciting Street Food in Ho Chi Minh

strIntroduction: This activity is a great way to strengthen your team bonds, whether it's a group of friends or coworkers. We will start in Ho Chi Minh City at 8:00am, from where you will be transported to HCM Agricultural Villages. HCM Agricultural Villages, 8:45am – 10:00am - Visiting cow, buffalo, fish, prawn, chicken and duck areas - Visiting rice fields, big herbs, spices, vegetables and mushrooms areas Cooking time, 10:00am -12:00pm - Dividing the Group into small Teams and choosing Team Leaders for each of them (each Team will have 1 Chef and 1 Assistant Chef to help them) - Cooking Demonstration (2 dishes) - Challenges in the Garden and Cooking Challenges - Best team will be decided following three categories: speed, flavor, decoration Reward Ceremony, 12:00pm – 12:15pm - Presentation of Winners and rewarding them - Each member will receive the certificate, recipes and souvenirs too Lunch Time, 12:15pm – 1:15pm - Selection of 7 dishes from our Great Set Menu Visiting local cows, 1:15pm -2:00pm - Understanding how the locals look after the Cows. Milk cows yourself and enjoy fresh, natural milk, so hard to find in the modern world. The Journey will end at 4:00pm in HCM City Enjoy this great and unique experience and about agriculture in Vietnam. Build team spirit while enjoying delicious Vietnamese cuisine!
strTitle: Build team spirit with a cooking class in Cu Chi

strIntroduction: On this journey, we will head out of Ho Chi Minh City towards Tan Phu Trung village and ride bikes through villages where the scars of war are still evident. We will ride along paved roads and dirt paths past bomb craters that bear witness to years of struggle during the years of conflict. Next, we will bring you through rubber plantations to observe the local harvesters as they gather latex from the trees. You will get to participate in a rice paper-making workshop before arriving at the Cu Chi tunnels for a 15-minute documentary about their creation. Learn about the history of conflict between the Cu Chi people and their rivals. Continue on toward the tunnel site where simple weapons for fighting are displayed. Then, head down real tunnels dug by the Viet Cong and experience just how brave the Vietnamese were during the war. Afterwards, enjoy authentic Viet Cong food in a historical kitchen. Hop back on the bus for your transfer back to Ho Chi Minh City and your hotel.
strTitle: Take a half-day bike tour to the historic Cu Chi Tunnels

strIntroduction: We’ll take the bikes for a ride into Hoi An and the surrounding area. We ride right across Hoi An and continue along the Thu Bon River through shrimp and coconut farms where the VC lived during the Vietnam War. We will then continue to Cua Dai beach. From here we get on a local ferry for a 10 minute ride to Duy Hai Fishing Village (island). Just a short distance away is the lovely town of Thuan Tinh, set among rice fields and coconut groves. We will visit a strawberry garden, meet the local villagers, and will have the chance to sample strawberry tea and perhaps buy some homemade strawberry wine. If you don’t mind creepy crawlies, we can also witness live silkworms in various stages of maturity. Next, we’ll check out Thanh Ha ceramic village and then we’ll take a one hour boat journey back to Hoi An and have lunch. The rest of the afternoon is yours entirely, to do whatever you wish to – tan on the beach, shopping, exploring – whatever!
strTitle: See the Hoi An countryside with a bike tour

strIntroduction: Amazing Farming with Cu Chi Tunnels Trip is an eye-opening program for people who love the countryside, love agriculture and love to discover and understand the history of the great Vietnamese cuisine. Our master chef will explain all the recipes and give them to you after the trip. We start in a hotel in Ho Chi Minh City at 8:00 am and drive to HCM Agricultural Villages - HCM Cooking School at 9:00 am - Visiting HCM Agricultural Villages 9:00 am - 10:00 am - Visiting buffalo, cows, fish, prawn areas - Visiting mushroom areas and understanding how to make healthy mushrooms - Visiting herbs, spices and vegetables areas and understanding what you can use for cooking and medicine - Being the farmer from 10:00 am -11:00 am - Hands on practice of how to make rice fields or growing things in the garden - Lunch time : 11:00 am -1:00 pm - Watch our master chef demonstrate recipes in front of you and enjoying what you see ( special menu offer if you have ) - Cow milking time: 1:00 pm -1:30 pm - Visiting cow milking areas and milking the cows by yourself to make coffee mill - Rice Paper Villages - rubber tree forest 1:30 pm -2:30 pm - Visiting Rice Papers Villages and understanding how to make rice papers. Do you think you know the main ingredient? You'll be surprised to find the answer! - Visiting the rubber tree forest and understanding how to get latex and how it can be used - Exploring Cu Chi Tunnel 2:30 pm -4:00 pm - Watching a presentation video - Getting to see the tunnels and discover how these tunnels were constructed and how its inhabitants fought two forces: the invading troops and the tunnels itself. - Visiting Hoang Cam's smokeless store, secret hide-outs, fighting bunkers, and many dangerous booby traps. - Trying gun shooting with real bullets (fees not included) - Tasting boiled tapioca, drinking hot tea The Trip will end about 5:00 pm in front of your hotel Enjoy an amazing, unique experience about Vietnamese agriculture - cuisine - culture - history
strTitle: Go on a farming trip and visit the Cu Chi Tunnels

strIntroduction: Set out along the Red River Delta, towards the village of Bat Trang – by bike! Your guide will introduce you to the skilled craftsmen operating the local workshop. Watch him as he works his magic, and even have a go yourself at creating your own ceramic masterpiece! You will continue your trail along the cultivated rice fields of the delta until you arrive in Dong Ho. Another village, another creative speciality: this time it is the village of Dong Ho and its traditional folk woodcut painting. After lunch you will travel another 8km to the But Thap Pagoda, situated on a dike of the Duong River. Like most Buddhist Temples, But Thap comprises of a series of buildings laid out in linear form, which move successively towards the center. You will be given an hour to explore the peaceful surroundings before loading up the van and taking a relaxing journey back to Hanoi.
strTitle: Cycle through the Red River Delta to its artisanal villages

strIntroduction: Explore the waterways in and around Saigon to see what life is like for people living and working in this amazingly diverse and rapidly developing city. In minutes, leave the urban metropolis behind to emerge along scenic jungle-fringed canals and minor tributaries where locals still observe traditional ways of life not far from the city center. You will visit the floating temples in GoVap District, travel around Thanh Da Island and the Binh Quoi Peninsula. A light dinner of Vietnamese dishes will be served during your two-hour tour. Return to Saigon just after sunset to see the city‘s ever-changing skyline and bridges lit up spectacularly at night.
strTitle: Enjoy the sunset in Ho Chi Minh on a private cruise

strIntroduction: Go on an eco-adventure to the mangrove forests of Can Gio! Ride through scenic canals, briefly entering the Mekong Delta at a local riverside market where you can absorb all the colors, sounds and aromas of this fertile region. Once we leave the leafy palms behind you will be enveloped in a dusky twilight world. Spot monkeys and gibbons swinging through the trees at Vam Sat. Feed the crocodiles at the crocodile reserve and paddle around the still waters of the bat lagoon in a small wooden boat. See villagers hand-knotting nets before spreading them out to dry in the sun at a local fishing hamlet. A breakfast of pastries, fresh fruits and Vietnamese coffee will be served as we depart Saigon, and Vietnamese specialties on-board for lunch. Tour starts at 7.30AM
strTitle: Go on an eco-adventure in Can Gio mangrove forest
