strIntroduction: HCM Agricultural Villages is a village with an area of over 150,000 square meters, located on the dirt roads of Cu Chi Province which is about 35 km away from Ho Chi Minh City. In this village, there is an evident blend of the culinary culture of the Cu Chi people and the general food culture of Vietnam. Visitors will be exposed to the life of the countryside as they take in the surrounding sights and sounds of the livestock and birdsong in the mornings. Cu Chi is also famous for its cattle. Here visitors will see herds of wandering cows on the field, and understand more about the day-to-day activities of the locals. In an age where farming employs science and technology, the local people still choose to retain the traditional methods of farming. Buffalos can be seen plowing on the fields. Here, visitors will better understand a known Vietnamese proverb: "Buffalo buffalo oh I say this / out field buffalo buffalo plow with us / plow is the rural / buffalo mine there, who would take over ...". Visitors will discover and better understand the process of rice cultivation by local people. In addition, visitors will visit and discover vegetable gardens containing mushrooms, fruits and herbs with an area of over 15,000 square meters. They will get to understand more about the process of growing vegetables, mushroom cultivation method, to explore new fruits and get to know how to incorporate herbs into their daily meals. Moreover, visitors will become farmers for the day as they don Vietnamese Traditional Hat and use Bamboo Baskets with scissors to harvest vegetables, mushrooms, fruits and herbs from the garden to use for cooking with a professional chef. Apart from farming, visitors will get to take a trip to the fish, prawn lake and poultry areas, where visitors will see some lovely prawn, fish on the lake and chickens and ducks on Rice Fields Starting from 5am to 6pm everyday, visitors can see the local people in our Villages engaging in various activities and join with them if they want such as feeding the cow, picking up vegetables such as cucumber, okra, bitter melon, squash ,white radish …. Lastly, visitors will get a chance to cook and eat unique dishes. With an area of over 200 square meters with a capacity of over 200 guests for cooking class and 300 guests for restaurant, this is the place where visitors can get to taste the nutritious and fresh produce after harvesting them. With our very own professional chef, it will be a great opportunity for visitors to understand the various techniques and secrets behind making Vietnamese cuisine. Visitors who complete the cooking class will leave with a certificate, recipes and their own culinary creations.
strTitle: Take a farm trip and cooking class in Ho Chi Minh

strIntroduction: RURAL ADVENTURE IN CU CHI PROGRAM (2 days / 1 night) This is a amazing program to bring visitors to experience life in rural areas of Cu Chi province in 2 days. Visitors will visit Cu Chi tunnels – one of the most attractive place in Vietnam, explore some other fantastic destinations, cook & enjoy healthy, organic food at HCM Cooking Class.We offer a unique guest house – Canh Sang guest house which has a beautiful garden and is a complete get-away from the hustle and bustle of the city and visitors will have a chance to interact with the local people and discover rural Vietnam lifestyle. DAY 1 9:00am - 11:00am : Picking up at airport (hotel) 11:00am - 1:00pm : Lunch time at Cassava Root restaurant and fishing time 1:00pm - 1:30pm : Visiting Rice paper village 1:30pm - 2:00pm : Visiting Rubber tree forest 2:00pm - 4:00pm : Visiting Cu Chi tunnels 4:00pm until night : Leave luggage in accommodation, time for shopping & sightseeing around countryside at night and enjoy so many activities such as BBQ time ,making Vietnamese cake, watching the sunset DAY 2 9:00am - 2:00pm : HCM Cooking Class and visit to HCM Agricultural Villages 2:00pm - 3:00pm : Visiting local cow milk 3:00pm - 3:30pm : Visiting bonsai & animals farm 3:30pm - 4:30pm : Back to respective hotels in Ho Chi Minh City
strTitle: Embark on a rural adventure tour (2 days 1 night)

strIntroduction: You will absolutely experience Vietnam on this trip, from the forest to the coastline; from mainland to islands all in one trip. An experienced Vietnamese cycle guide will lead the tour. Plus, we will supply detailed route notes and maps so that you will enjoy complete freedom while riding. Brief Itinerary Day1: Sai Gon - Da Lat (40km Cycling) (L,D) Transfer out of the bustling Saigon city to go to Bao Loc, home land of tea plantations; lunch at a local restaurant. Keep transferring to Prenn waterfall for a short rest and sight seeing. Arrive at Dalat city, check in at the hotel and cycle around the undulating city passing by Xuan Huong lake, Da Lat flower garden, Da Lat market, and Mt. Langbiang. Arrive back at the hotel late in the cool evening. Stay overnight in Da Lat. Day2: Da Lat City Tour (60km cycling) (B,L,D) Cycle to the Valley of Love, Bao Dai Palace, Crazy House, and visit the Truc Lam pagoda by cable car. Lunch at a local restaurant. The rest of the day is free for you to do as you please in the cool-climate highland city. Overnight in Da Lat. Day3: Da Lat - Nha Trang (100km cycling) (B,L,D) Breakfast at the hotel. Cycle from the hotel through pine tree forests along the way to the Dien Khanh old citadel. Have a picnic lunch on the way. Transfer the rest when we reach highway 1 to Nha Trang. Visit the Ponagar Cham tower if time permits. Stay overnight in Nha Trang beach city. Day4: Nha Trang - Tuy Hoa (80km cycling) (B,L,D) Early morning swimming at the beach, do Tai Chi with the locals, breakfast at the hotel. Check out and drive to Ninh Hoa in 40 minutes. Bike ride over the Co Ma Pass, down hill with a scenic view of the sea and mountains to Dai Lanh sandy beach. A Seafood lunch will be served. Cycle the peaceful roads to Tuy Hoa where will stay overnight. Day5: Tuy Hoa - Quang Ngai (60km cycling) (B,L,D) Transfer a short way to outside the city where today's ride will be along the challenging dirt country roads. After a picnic lunch, the way to the town where we will be staying overnight will be relaxed on an air-conditioned bus. We will stay overnight in Quang Ngai historical city. Day6: Quang Ngai - Hoi An (50km cycling) (B,L,D) Start to ride from the hotel to where the My Lai massacre was in 1968. Then we will visit a school for charity, and cycle to My Khe beach for lunch. We will take the country roads for the afternoon ride, reaching the highway 1 and transfering to Hoi An, an ancient world heritage town where we will stay overnight. Day7: Hoi An option (B) You may have a whole free day in Hoi An for exploring on your own. Or we may cycle to My Son heritage site, have a cooking class, or go snorkeling (option). Overnight in Hoi An. Day8: Hoi An - Hue (80km cycling) (B,L,D) We will leave the old lantern town for the coast of China beach to Ngu Hanh Son (Marble Mountains) to visit some stone sculptures. There are hundreds of statues, products made of sandstone and marble by local craftsmen. We will cycle along the coast and up to Hai Van Pass - a legendary Pass in the center of Vietnam (20km cycling up and down) from the 14th century. Have lunch at Lang Co beach - one of the most beautiful beaches in the world recognized by UNESCO. We will relax after eating on the bus and transfer to Phuoc Tuong hill. Ride from the top hill down the railway to Cau Hai lagoon, and through the "ghost city" before arriving in Hue where we will stay overnight. Day9: Hue - Hanoi (25km cycling) (B,L,D) We will take a morning ride around the city to visit the Hue old Citadel of the Nguyen Dynasty of 19th & 20th century, Thien Mu pagoda and Tu Duc King Tomb. We will then go back to the hotel for checking out. We will have lunch in Hue before taking the airport to Hanoi (600km). We will stay overnight in Hanoi. Day10: Hanoi city tour (no cycling) (B,L,D) Arrive in Hanoi at about 5:00am. Transfer to the hotel for a short rest, and enjoy a breakfast at Pho24 (traditional vietnamese noodle) near Ho Guom Lake. We will do a city tour to visit the Temple of Literature, Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum complex and one pillar pagoda. The afternoon is free. We will stay overnight in Ha Noi. Day11: Ha Noi departure (no cycling) (B) End of the tour and welcome back. If you have an onward flight, we will transfer you to the airport.
strTitle: Travel Saigon - Hanoi by bike

strIntroduction: ベトナム観光時のためにあなたにぴったりの通訳者を手配致します！ 現地で活躍中の学生があなたの旅をより良いものへするためのお手伝いを致します。 通訳を担当する学生は日本語、ベトナム語両方を巧みに操ることが可能です。 言葉の壁のある旅行者と現地の人を繋ぐ 為の橋渡しをします！ (photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/poetprince/4451124907/) (photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/sujuhyte/5388235963/) (photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/hrdrck/3217485706/) (photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/hrdrck/3217482752/)
strTitle: ベトナムでの通訳を手配します！

strIntroduction: In this day tour, I will bring you to visit the 4 majestic waterfalls of Dalat on my motorbike - Datania, Pren, Pongour, and Elephant Waterfall. We will also see other offbeat attractions along the way such as the Ghost House of Dalat. We will begin by visiting the Truc Lam Meditation Center and Tuyen Lam Lake - Datanla Waterfall This 20m high waterfall crashes into a deep pool at the foot of the waterfall called the Deadly Abyss. With rapids and large streams of water, the lower section is known to locals as Suoi Tien. - Ghost House of Dalat This beautiful but cursed house that lies next to the highway in Dalat was intended to be renovated into a hotel, but its owner died before the plans could be completed. - Pren Waterfall Guests can scale down this waterfall from a height of nearly 10m. Water flows in between granite rocks, spreading evenly like a watery curtain or fairy's hair . There is a small valley nearby with a beautiful flower garden. - Pongour Waterfall Considered by many as the most beautiful and impressive waterfall in the highlands, Pongour Waterfalls cascades from a height of nearly 40 meters and spans over 100 meters. It is also surrounded by virgin forests covering an area of approximately 2.5 hectares with diverse vegetation and abundant wildlife. - Elephant Waterfall Elephant waterfall, also called Lieng Rowoa, has a width of about 40m and is over 30m in height. Legend has it that the elephants mourned the death of a lady who loved elephants, crying until they passed away at the foot of the waterfall. The roaring of the waterfall day and night creates a sound like the roar of wild animals. Elephant waterfall was recognized as a national monument in 2001. - Silk factory OR Coffee Plantations Choose to visit a Silk Factory and see how local embroidered silk is made, or visit a coffee plantation and enjoy local coffee.
strTitle: Visit the 4 Majestic Waterfalls of Dalat by Motorbike

strIntroduction: The traditional meal is hosted in our members' houses and will introduce you to Vietnamese food and Vietnamese Family culture. Tourists will have a chance of learning to cook Vietnamese food by themselves and discover Vietnamese family culture. Our staff will pick you up from your hotel and take you to your host. From there, you'll be taken to the local market to buy fresh ingredients and then it's back to the host's home to learn some Vietnamese cooking and enjoy a delicious meal.
strTitle: Discover Vietnamese Family culture and Taste Vietnamese Food

strIntroduction: Volunteer Tour-Guides in Saigon In the early 20th century Saigon was called the "Pearl of the Far East". Today you will still see elegant buildings designed by French architects: the Opera House, City hall, Saigon Notre-Dame Basilica, City Post Office. You will also come face to face with Vietnam history at the Reunification Palace, War Remnants Museum and the Historical Museum. Saigon is one of the most dynamic cities in Asia, therefore, together with us, you will discover street life: the street-side cafés, vendors with motorbikes and scooters rushing all around...Our volunteers from Saigon Hotpot will be enthusiastic to take you around the city without any fee. All you have to pay is your own expense and invite our volunteers a meal where you can sit together and know more about local people's life. In this tour we will take you - Ben Thanh market - City Hall - Opera house - Notre Dame Cathedral - Reunification Palace - War Remnants Museum - Jade Emperor Temple
strTitle: Walking and Taxi Tour of Saigon

strIntroduction: What we offer is a night of restaurant-hopping from street food vendor to vendor. Trying and sampling the best of each dish is the best part of any foodie's tour, and that's exactly what we'll do. We will try at least 3 savoury dishes and desserts, as well as some snacks and drinks. We are able to cater to most food allergies and dietary restrictions.
strTitle: Savour the street food of Ho Chi Minh City on a motorbike

strIntroduction: The experience will be 4 hours of intensive DJ training using the 'Gold Standard' turntables the Technics SL1200 Mark 3D and Rane Serato TTM 57SL Audio Interface and Mixer. The host has all of this equipment set up and ready for your lessons. Serato Scratch Live is a Vinyl Emulation Hardware and software Package that allows the user to manipulate MP3 files from a digital format using the Analog Turntables and Mixer. What to expect - The lessons will start with theory of the technology and move on to beat-matching, turntable techniques including cueing, slowing down and speeding up the record. Additionally, the experience will involve using actual Vinyl records instead of the software. You can choose whatever style of music you want for the experience, by bringing either your laptop and/or a hard drive/USB flashcard with your music on it. The experience is targeted at any individual regardless of previous experience of Dj'ing from Beginners to Intermediate. Digital DJ'in (using programs to do all the hard work for you) removes the skill and human element of Dj'ing, this is why I am offering these Vinyl lessons - At the End of the Experience, you'll get a chance to play in the Bar/Club in front of a Live Crowd as a reward for completing the Lessons. Additionally, you will receive a certificate of completion along with photos of your Live DJ set! Option 1 - 4 Hour Lesson (2 hours per day) Play in front of a live crowd! Option 2 - 4 Hour Lesson (1 hour per day - 4 day course) Play in front of a live crowd! Option 3 - 4 Hour Lesson (2 hours per day) 9pm -12am All you can drink on every day of the lesson! (Rum/Vodka + Mixer or Beer) Play in front of a live crowd! Option 4 - 4 Hour Lesson (1 hour per day - 4 day course) Play in front of a live crowd! 9pm -12am All you can drink on every day of the lesson! (Rum/Vodka + Mixer or Beer) Option 5 - 4 Hour Lesson (2 hours per day) Italian Dinner 8pm - 9pm 9pm -12am All you can drink on every day on the lesson! (Rum/Vodka + Mixer or Beer) Play in front of a live crowd! Option 6 - 4 Hour Lesson (1 hour per day - 4 day course) Italian Dinner 8pm - 9pm 9pm -12am All you can drink (Rum/Vodka + Mixer or Beer) Play in front of a live crowd!
strTitle: Learn the Art of Vinyl Dj'ing & Play to a Live Crowd!

strTitle: PARTY with Saigon's BEST Party Tour/Pub Crawl

strIntroduction: With this experience you will get to know the true spirit of Saigon. We will start at 9am with a walk to one of the best markets in the city, where our chefs will walk you from vendor to vendor. All ingredients necessary to prepare lunch will be purchased and then we will travel to the cooking place by taxi. After the cooking class is finished we will take you by taxi to the best spa around for a 1 1/2 hour full body massage. When you are completely relaxed, you will be picked up by motorbike for night time city and street food tour through the many districts of Ho Chi Minh City, where you will get to experience the night life of the city and taste 5 delicious courses along the way. The day will end at 8pm with a drop off at your hotel in District 1 (extra fees for drop-off in other districts.)
strTitle: Take a day tour all around Saigon

strIntroduction: The popping of a champagne bottle will start the fun and entertaining night that you will share with your partner. We will create classic Vietnamese food, with our American chefs supervising while you and your partner put together a five course all by yourselves. After each of them is prepared you will have a chance to enjoy it with free beverages. When the class ends you will receive tips and suggestions that will help you recreate these wonderful dishes outside of Vietnam. Couples Menu: Hen Tron Banh Da - Stir Fried Baby Clam and Sate with Crispy Rice Cracker Ha Cao - Steamed Chewy Dumplings Banh Xeo - Crispy Rice Flour ”Crepe,” Stuffed with Shrimp, Pork and Bean sprouts. Served with Fresh Lettuce and Sweet Fish Sauce. Com Ga - Boiled Chicken Served with flavored rice and Cabbage, Banana Flower Salad Banh Chuoi Hap - Steamed Banana Cake with Thick Coconut Milk Banh Cam - Crispy Mung Bean Stuffed Rice Flour Fritters
strTitle: Learn to make Vietnamese dishes

strIntroduction: One of the things that makes Vietnam so unique and interesting are the Vietnamese markets. They are full of colors, scents, and offer an incredible choice of exotic ingredients. That is why the class starts here with our chefs navigating you through stalls. After shopping we will proceed back to begin our introduction to Vietnamese cuisine. During this preparation time chefs will work one on one with each of the students to ensure the best cooking experience for everyone, no matter the skill level of the student. We will help with culinary basics such as handling the knife, cooking techniques, and organization that will benefit every apprentice in any kitchen. When the dishes are done, the class will sit down and enjoy our meals together, in a way dictated by Vietnamese spirit. Menu: 1 (classes held on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday of every week) Goi Ngo Sen – Lotus Stem Salad with Shrimp and Pork served with Prawn Crackers Thit Kho Trung – Pork Belly and Egg Braised in Fish Sauce Caramel Served with Steamed Rice Che Chuoi Nong – Warm Bannana and Coconut Milk Pudding —– Menu: 2 (classes held on Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday) Goi Cuon - Salad Roll stuffed with Shrimp and Pork Served with 2 different sauces Canh Chua - Sweet and Sour Seafood Soup, Flavored with Tamarind, Pineapple and Tomato, served with White Rice. Xoi Va Nuoc Cot Dua- Sticky Rice with Coconut Milk
strTitle: Whip up authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a cooking class

strIntroduction: Experience one of the best cuisines in the world by a highly skilled chef. Chad, who is our resident chef, will prepare a delicious, custom menu of his favorites. Chad is able to create menus focused on certain concepts, be it “soups”, “pork dishes” or “exotic ingredients”... or you can just trust his choice. Whether you are a food professional looking to explore your knowledge or a passionate foodie, this is an experience that will deeply immerse you into Vietnamese cuisine, which is considered one of the best in the world.
strTitle: Take an amazing food tour with a 4 star chef

strIntroduction: Travelling in Vietnam is often on the back of a bike. Meet with one of our hosts, who will take you on a ride through the city. We’ll taste some Vietnamese drinks, a local breakfast or lunch. We will ride next to both the most luxurious buildings in Vietnam and huts of the poorest on our way. There will be a chance to explore the labyrinth of District 4's alleys and all the diversity that Ho Chi Minh City has to offer. Each ride is a unique experience of the daily life of local people. See, Smell, Taste, Hear, and Feel - use all five senses to feel the energy of this amazing city and its inhabitants.
strTitle: Explore Ho Chi Minh City by Motorbike

strIntroduction: Ho Chi Minh City is virtually a paradise for foodies, as there is something new and delicious to try on nearly every corner. Different restaurants and carts specialize in different dishes, and one of the best things a visitor can do here is to take a food tour that includes several popular dishes. This tour starts in the late morning at Thai Binh market, not far from downtown Ho Chi Minh. The best thing here is bun thit nuong, which is dry noodles served with pork and vegetables. Order a fresh fruit smoothie or juice on the side and this is a great start to the tour. Other vendors in the market will offer their dishes as well, so feel free to browse. Afterwards we will head to District 3 to eat at one of the best pho places in town, Pho Le. Pho is Vietnam's most famous dish, and in my humble opinion you can't visit Saigon without eating here. If you're still hungry we'll have dessert at a stall down the street, which is a splendid end to a great feast.
strTitle: Take a heavenly Ho Chi Minh food tour

strIntroduction: 旅行時に一番もどかしいのが、現地の人だけが知っているような、隠れ家的お店の情報が手に入りづらいこと。 特にホーチミンは歴史的にフランスや中国文化の影響が残っていることから、センスのいいカフェ、バー、レストランが数多くあります。そういったお店に限って地球の歩き方などガイドブックには載っていません。 ということもあり今回はそんな隠れ家的お店を案内させて頂きます。 ホストといってもランチかディナーをご一緒させて頂くのみなので、所要時間は１〜１時間半程になります。食事費用はご自身の負担でお願いいたします。（僕の分は自分で支払います）
strTitle: ホーチミンの隠れ家カフェ・バー・レストランへご案内！

strIntroduction: Designed for those who want a relaxed introduction to scuba diving, our introductory course will allow our guests to enjoy the experience under direct supervision of a professional dive instructor (without having to complete a full scuba certification course). Almost anyone can enjoy this experience! The introductory course includes a short theory lesson, a pool session and 2 stunning dives. One in Coral garden and one in The liberty shipwreck. The duration is 6 hours and we will give you a free CD of your underwater photos of the dives. The pool session will allow beginners to learn the various important signs and breathing techniques required to ensure their safety during the dive. It will also let them get used to the weight of the equipment and it's functions underwater. If you are a certified diver, you are welcome to join your non-certified diver friends at a discounted price (see the drop down box for more details). It is cheaper because it does require you to join the pool-session. 2 OTHER MORE ADVANCED COURSES IF YOU'RE INTERESTED: 1. The PADI Scuba Diver course (2D/1N) is a pre-entry level certification that is perfect for people who only plan to dive a few times a year to maximum 12 meters /40 feet. The PADI Scuba Diver rating allows you to get certified quickly and easily. With the Scuba Diver certification you can dive under the direct supervision of a PADI professional. This course includes 3 theory sessions, 3 pool sessions and 3 open water dives. 2. PADI Open Water Diver Course (3D/2N) - This is the complete introduction to the wider world of diving. The PADI Open Water Diver course is the most widely recognized diving certification in the world. Within a few days you can be enjoying the underwater world. As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you will have the freedom to dive with a buddy independently of a professional.This course includes 5 theory sessions, 5 pool sessions and 4 open water dives. U.S.A.T Liberty History: The U.S.A.T Liberty ship was a cargo boat, 120 meters long, of the US Navy. The ship received a torpedo from a Japanese submarine in 1942 during the second world war but the boat didn’t sink directly. A tugboat from Holland towed it from the island of Lombok to Tulamben, where they beached it to salvage what was left of the cargo The ship stayed there until 1963 when the big volcano “Gunung Agung” erupted, and tremors and lava flow pushed the ship into the sea where it lies now. The shipwreck is located between 3 to 35 meters of water. Access is from the shore, descending along the sandy bottom. A few tunnels are accessible for experienced divers, and there is a also the cargo hold, which is very safe over-head environment even for inexperienced divers. The biodiversity of the site is incredible and the ship is covered of brilliant corals and multicolor sponges. There are big schools of Jackfish, Giant wrasse, Bumphead parrotfish, moray-eel, turtle, barracuda and occasionally black tip reef shark. It also a great site for macro with frequent sightings of Pygmy sea horse, leaf fish, gost-pipefish, frogfish and more. It makes for a glorious night dive, when your flashlight can pick up the incredible richness of the colors. The current is generally mild but sometimes in August bigger waves can make access more difficult.
strTitle: Bali Scuba Diving at the Majestic Tulamben Liberty Wreck

strIntroduction: Mt. Batur is a Bali landmark like no other - at 1717 meters, it is the 2nd highest point of Bali. Join knowledgeable and experienced hiking guides for this stunning overnight trek up Bali's most popular volcano - Mount Batur. You start with an early morning pickup from your hotel. You will be taken to the iconic Toya Bungkah village (famous for the volcanic hot springs) and begin your ascend up the volcano under the twinkling stars in the cool morning air. When you get to the peak, you'll witness the most majestic sight you've likely ever seen - watching the sun rise over Bali from above the clouds. The views are breathtaking and absolutely stunning. While you are there, you will enjoy a simple breakfast of tea and eggs cooked in volcanic steam and get to enjoy the amazing viewpoint. As your descent begins, you will explore the three younger craters while we take in the amazing volcanic landscape. *If you wish to spend the night camping at the top of Mount Batur in a tent, please click here : https://www.govoyagin.com/activities/indonesia-bali-mt-batur-bali-sunrise-sunset-camping/4616 AVAILABLE OPTIONS AND ADD-ONS: 1. REGULAR HIKE- an early morning pick up from your hotel takes you straight to our start point 2. OVERNIGHT EXPERIENCE - experience the mountain in an overnight stay in the hot spring village of Toya Bungkah (save 2 extra hours of sleep!) 3. HOT SPRINGS (recommended option) - as an add-on, after your trek, you can opt to go to the natural hot springs of Toya Bungkah, some of Bali's best. Soak, refresh and swim in the natural hot and cold water pools for a refreshing time after your trek! ****************************************************** 1. ITINERARY FOR REGULAR HIKE: 01.15 - 02.30: Pick-up at your hotel, head directly to your starting point in the village of Toya Bungkah 03.15 – 03.30: Arrival at starting point, introduction and safety procedure briefing by your English-speaking guide 03.30 – 03.45: Begin trek to Mount Batur 04.00 – 06.00: Climb to the summit crater 06.15 – 06.45: Arrival at the summit crater, witness the spectacular sunrise. Enjoy refreshments of hot tea and eggs boiled in volcanic steam. 07.00: Continue the trek around the entire crater. 08.00: Begin our descent to Jati Temple, the finishing point of the trek. 09.00 – 09.30: Depart to the hotel 12.00 – 12.30: Arrival at the hotel PICK UP TIMES: 01.15 - 01.30am : Kuta, Seminyak, Nusa Dua, Candidasa, Lovina, Sidemen 1.30-1.45am : Sanur Area 02.30am : Ubud Area 01.00am : Amed Area 3.00am: Kintamani Area 2. ITINERARY FOR OVERNIGHT HIKE*: DAY 1: - Afternoon: Pick up at your hotel (see exact pick up times below) - 15.00 - 16.00: Arrive at Bali Sunrise Villas in Toya Bungkah village. Check in and relax. OPTIONAL: You can walk to the hot springs (2 minutes walk away) for a relaxing soak (the springs close around 7pm). The ticket price for this is 150,000 IDR extra per person (please bring cash to pay them directly). - 19.00: Return to the villas where we prepare dinner for you. Indonesian and European food is available on our a la carte menu (additional price depending on what you order). DAY 2: Same as the regular hike but wake up call at 3.15am PICK UP TIMES: Nusa Dua: 13.00 (on Day 1) Kuta: 13.30 (on Day 1) Sanur, Candidasa, Lovina: 14.00 (on Day 1) Ubud: 15.00 (on Day 1) Amed: 13.00 - 14.00 (on Day 1) NOTE: Solo travellers are most welcome! We will try our best to combine your hotel pick up with other guests heading up the mountain so that you can benefit from the cost savings for the trek, however in case we don't have anyone else climbing on your preferred dates, you'll need to purchase the "Private Trek" add-on option if you'd still like to climb. If we're not able to match your booking and you don't want to pay extra, no worries, you'll receive a full refund for your booking. *If you wish to spend the night camping at the top of Mount Batur, please click here : https://www.govoyagin.com/activities/indonesia-bali-mt-batur-bali-sunrise-sunset-camping/4616
strTitle: 10% OFF Mt. Batur Volcano Sunrise Trek / Private Path Hike

strIntroduction: Bali is known world-wide for it's culture, but while you are in Bali, don't forget to pay a visit to the Ayung River - the most beautiful and longest river in Bali, a Class II river that rises up to Class IV during rainy season. The scenery along the river is spectacular, and as you come rafting down with the current with us, you will be able to immerse yourself in the gorgeous rainforest bordering the river. Your rafting adventure starts at our traditional wantilan Balinese lobby set in the middle of rice fields overlooking the breathtaking Mt. Abang. Right from here, you will experience genuine service and luxury. Fully equipped with rafting equipment and photo displays of safety procedures, you begin with an introduction to your guides who will brief you the safety procedure and tips to have an enjoyable rafting experience in English, Korean, Mandarin, Japanese and/or Indonesian. From here, you'll set off on your 2 hour adventure - an unrivaled and unique way to appreciate the natural scenery of Bali. Journeying down the Ayung, you'll see dramatic waterfalls, lush rainforest, verdant rice paddies, high cliffs and breathtaking gorges during which you'll get wet and wild! Your guides will make your experience even better by entertaining you with jokes and pointing out the different species of wildlife and exotic plants of the island, all while keeping your safety in mind. Upon completion, a tasty and flavorful buffet lunch is served in our duplex restaurant with stunning views of the Ayung valley and rice fields. Our state-of-the-art landing facility also includes showers, a toilet, bar, and tropical garden with free Wi-Fi access throughout. So, are you ready to get splashed and scream with excitement? See you soon at our rafting house! PICK UP TIMES (Drop off around 5-6 hours later at your hotel) Morning Trip 07:45 - 08:15: Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Uluwatu 08:00 - 08:30: Kuta / Legian / Seminyak / Canggu / Tuban 08:30 - 09:00: Sanur 08:45 - 09:15: Ubud Afternoon Trip 12:15 - 12:45: Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Uluwatu 12:30 - 13:00: Kuta / Legian / Seminyak / Canggu / Tuban 13:00 - 13:30: Sanur 13:15 - 13:45: Ubud
strTitle: 50% OFF White Water Rafting Bali in Ubud - Ayung River

strIntroduction: Our canyoning tours are a fun and lighthearted way to discover the amazing sport of canyoning. Our canyons are located in Git Git in the north of Bali and practicable on throughout the year. Each is made of a variety of segments which you will enjoy: swims, natural water slides, jumps, rappels, and wonderful scenes of plant-covered, volcanic rock and natural warm spring basins which make these sporty descent lots of fun. There are FOUR options for your fun day canyoning: 1. Kalimudah Canyoning Adventure (easy beginner's introduction) 2. Double K Discovery Canyoning Adventure (slightly longer and more adventurous trip) 3. Kerenkali Canyoning Adventure (an action-packed day in one of Bali's most sporty canyons) 4. Tamata Canyoning Adventure (for those who don't know how to swim) 5) Aling Gorges Canyoning Adventure (the most adventurous option for the thrill-seekers!) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1) KALIMUDAH CANYONING ADVENTURE (shortest) Canyoning Level: Beginner Physical Condition: For Everybody Descent: 2 - 2.5 hours Approach: 20 minute walk Return: 10 minute walk, with a short picnic of Balinese cakes and tea. Jumps from up to 8m high (optional) Rappelling from up to 15m Slips down natural water slides up to 4m long Swimming up to 20m Minimum Age: 8 years old If you have never practiced before, Kalimudah will make you addicted to sporty descents. If you are already experienced, Kalimudah is a good start to enjoy the Balinese canyons. After you arrive at the last waterfall, we ferry you to a simple local lunch to celebrate an unforgettable day in nature. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2) DOUBLE K DISCOVERY CANYONING ADVENTURE Canyoning Level: Beginner - Advanced Physical Condition: For Everybody Descent: 3 - 3.5 hours Approach: 30 minute walk Return: 10 minute walk, with a short picnic of Balinese cakes and tea. Jumps from up to 8m high (optional) Rappelling from up to 15m Slips down natural water slides up to 6m long Swimming up to 20m Minimum Age: 16 years old Double K discovery is slightly more adventurous (longer descent) version of Kalimudah canyoning with 13 waterfalls ranging from 5 to 15m, several slides and jumps. After you arrive at the last waterfall, we ferry you to a simple local lunch to celebrate an unforgettable day in nature. Major fun guaranteed! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3) KERENKALI CANYONING ADVENTURE Canyoning Level: Beginner - Advanced Physical Condition: Must be in Good Shape Descent: 4 hours Approach: 10 minute walk Return: 10 minute walk, with a short picnic of Balinese cakes and tea. Jumps from up to 10m high (optional) Rappelling from up to 26m Slips down natural water slides up to 4m long Swimming up to 20m Minimum Age: 16 years old If you had to choose only one sporty canyon with water in Bali, Kerenkali would be perfect. Located to the north of Bali, Kerenkali is rich in colors and magic landscapes throughout your descent and can be conquered throughout the year. It has 2 single parts: the first one is a sequence of jumps, water slides, short rappels with gorges made of volcanic rock, and caves, a mix of fun and exploration. The second sportier part is filled with enchanting rappel descents along waterfalls (the highest is 26m), swims, jumps up to 10m (optional), floating, and Balinese lunch at the mid-way of the canyon. Kerenkali is a good choice for the beginners who are in good shape and for autonomous enthusiasts. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 4) TAMATA LOVE CANYONING ADVENTURE Canyoning Level: Beginner - Advanced Physical Condition: Must be in Good Shape Descent: 4.5 - 5 hours Approach: 45 minute walk Return: 30 minute walk, with a short picnic of Balinese cakes and tea. No Jumps Rappelling from 23m maximum Slips down natural water slides up to 2m long No Swimming Minimum Age: 16 years old Tamata canyon is one of mainly vertical descents and is located near the gorgeous Kintamani volcano area. It is also practicable throughout the year. After a descent of 45 min within a lush jungle, we will take you through a sequence of several rappels along waterfalls (23m at max) that will open us up to the magnificent Tamata gorge. With a height of more than 70m, the gorge provides fantastic views and a unique exploration experience. We will then enjoy a delicious local meal, follwed by an optional jump located mid-way through the canyon. Tamata is more than a simple descent; it is an authentic trip in the bowels of Bali, the discovery of a wild and exceptional place where simplicity equals beauty. It's a suitable choice for both beginners and advanced members who do not wish to jump or swim in natural pools. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 5) ALING GORGES CANYONING TRIP Canyoning Level: Beginner - Advanced Physical Condition: Must be in Excellent Shape Descent: 4hr 15m Approach: 0 minute walk Return: 15 minute walk, with a short picnic of Balinese cakes and tea. Jumps from 14m maximum Rappelling from 40m maximum Slips down natural water slides up to 2m long Swimming upto 50 m Minimum Age: 18 years old Although the most challenging of the lot, this is really heaven on earth. You will be immersed in the classic Bali rice terraces, far away from civilization. The 4th section of ALING GORGES, Palm, is a marvel of Balinese nature. Words are certainly not enough to describe the magic and incredible atmosphere all along the descent. Aling is a canyon that involves a lot of swimming, straight volcanic gorges along the descent and even bats waiting your visit to fly between the gorges! Lots of jumps, wonderful rappels, (the height of the last one is 40m!). ALING GORGE is a sporty descent, halfway between exploration, adventure and fun trip. Practicable few month a year ( depending the raining season) for all beginners of 18 years of age minimum in excellent shape.or autonomous Canyoneer. We can assure you that this trip will be rich in adrenalin, emotion, and beautiful landscapes. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The best part of all these trips is that you'll get all the pictures we take on the trip given to you on your USB flash drive or memory, so you can share your experience with your family and friends at home. For Kalimudah & Double K Discovery Nusa Dua / Jimbaran - Pick up: 5.30-5.45; Drop off: 4.30PM Seminyak / Legian / Kuta - Pick up: 5.45-6.00; Drop off: 4PM Canggu - Pick up: 6.00-6.15; Drop off: 4PM Ubud - Pick up: 5.45-6.15; Drop off: 4PM Lovina - Pick up: 7.00-7.15; Drop off: 2PM For Kerenkali trip Nusa Dua / Jimbaran - Pick up: 5.30-5.45; Drop off: 6PM Seminyak / Legian / Kuta - Pick up: 5.45-6.00; Drop off: 5PM Canggu - Pick up: 6.00-6.15; Drop off: 5PM Ubud - Pick up: 5.45-6.15; Drop off: 5PM Lovina - Pick up: 7.00-7.15; Drop off: 3PM For Tamata & Aling Gorges Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Uluwatu / Candidasa - Pick up: 5.00-5.15; Drop off: 5PM Seminyak / Legian / Kuta / Canggu / Sanur- Pick up: 5.30-6.00; Drop off: 5PM Ubud - Pick up: 6.00-6.15; Drop off: 5PM Lovina / Munduk - Pick up: 7.00-7.15; Drop off: 3PM
strTitle: Canyoning in Bali: An Unforgettable Waterfall Adventure!

strIntroduction: Depending on whether you'd prefer to spend more time relaxing at our beach club or maximizing your time doing watersports from our activity pontoon, we have 2 great cruises for you to enjoy. The Beach Club cruise is a good choice for those who want to soak in the sun and take it easy as you can use the pools, swing in the hammocks in the garden or just sunbathe on the beach. This is our recommendation for anyone looking to relax or families with children under the age of 6 as there are kid-friendly facilities such as a kids club, playground, shallow pool and other facilities that will keep them entertained throughout the day. The Reef cruise is a day on our activities pontoon where the water is always close. There is a sundeck for relaxing and getting a massage but this is the preferred choice for those looking to enjoy as many water sports as possible! You also have the option to join in on the ultimate marine adventure, the Aquanauts submerged Seawalker experience (minimum age 9 yrs old). Under the supervision of an experienced guide, you'll don a unique helmet that'll have you moon walking on the ocean floor, just like Astronauts in space! This easy and fun experience is the picture perfect moment for those who want to experience the underwater world for their first time without getting their face wet! Don't worry about safety either - before beginning your hour-long Aquanauts adventure, you'll get a full safety briefing (available in English, Indonesian, Japanese, Mandarin and Russian) to show you how to use the helmet to breathe underwater while walking in the midst of Lembongan's vibrant tropical reefs and diverse marine life. OPTION 1: Beach Club Cruise (more relaxing option) 7:15 Pick-up from your hotel 8:35 Boarding. Morning tea and coffee, pastries served. 9:15 Our boat departs Benoa Harbour. 10:00 Snorkeling demonstration on the Sundeck. 10:30 Our boat arrives at the pontoon in Lembongan Bay, guests transfer to our Beach Club on smaller vessels. 10:40 All activities commence at the Beach Club: - Semi-Submersible Coral Viewer departs at 11:45, 13:00 & 14:15 - Village Tours depart at 11:00 and 13:30 for about 45 minutes. - Snorkeling Tours depart at 11:00, 12:00 and 13:45. - Volleyball court available. - Banana Boat rides depart regularly from the beach. - Swimming and Snorkeling between the flags. If you opted for the Aquanauts experience, you'll be assigned a time slot for that 12:30 BBQ lunch is available until 14:00. Complimentary tea / coffee and water is served throughout the day at our restaurant. 13:15 Treasure hunt for children – meet at the information counter. 14:30 Tug of war on the beach. 14:45 When you hear the Kul Kul (traditional bell) please check you have all personal belongings and prepare for return to pontoon and our boat from the beach. 15:15 Enjoy the live band on the aft bridge deck. 16:15 We arrive back at Benoa Harbour. OPTION 2: Reef Cruise Schedule (for maximum time to enjoy water sports) 7:15 Pick-up from your hotel 8:45 Boarding. Morning tea and coffee, pastries served. 9:15 The boat departs Benoa Harbour. 10:00 Snorkeling demonstration on the Sundeck. 10:30 The boat arrives at the pontoon in Lembongan Bay, guests transfer to Beach Club on smaller vessels. All activities commence from the pontoon: - Semi-Submersible Coral Viewer begins operating from the pontoon, one trip lasts 25 minutes. - Banana Boat rides depart continuously from the pontoon. - Water slide begins operating. - Snorkeling equipment is available from the “crates” at the rear of the pontoon. - Towel hire and lockers are available at the pontoon bar - Fresh water showers are on the pontoon near the vessel boarding ramp. - Diving Board. - Underwater viewing chamber opens. - If you opted for the Aquanauts experience, you'll be assigned a time slot for that 11:30 Buffet lunch opens on the main deck, closes at 14:15. First Village Tour departs, returns at approx.12:30. 12:30 Second Village Tour departs, returns at approx. 13:30 13:30 Third Village Tour departs, returns at approx. 14:30 14:15 Buffet lunch closes, tea and coffee available until 15:15 15:00 Water activities finish. 15:10 Head count prior to departure. 15:15 We depart from the pontoon. Enjoy the live band on the aft bridge deck. 16:15 We arrive back at Benoa Harbour. PICK UP TIMES 07.15 - 07.30: Ubud / Tanah Lot 07.30 - 07.45: Seminyak/Legian/Bukit/Ulutwatu 07.45 - 08.00: Kuta / Tuban / Nusa Dua / Jimbaran 08.00 - 08.15: Sanur *************************************************************** OPTIONAL ACTIVITIES AVAILABLE (to be booked on the spot when you are on the cruise): 1. Parasailing: - Single US$25, - Tandem US$45 - Trio US$65 2. Massage - Approximately US$10/hour (massage staff will charge a Rupiah rate depending on the product chosen) 3. Pedicure & manicure - Approximately US$10 / service (the staff will charge a Rupiah rate depending on the product chosen)

strIntroduction: OUR PROPOSED ITINERARY: 10.00 : Depart from your hotel 11.00 : Taman Ayun Temple - a Royal Temple of the Mengwi empire 12.30 : Lake Beratan & its beautiful lake temple with a breathtaking mountain backdrop 13.15 : Visit Candi Kuning Market - a traditional fruit and flower market 14.00 : Lunch at Pacung restaurant with magnificent rice terrace views 16.00 : Jatiluwih Rice Terraces (a UNESCO World Heritage Site) 17.30 : Tanah Lot Temple for sunset 20.00 : Arrive at your hotel While there are many guides in Bali for you to choose from, rest assured that your comfort is our no. 1 priority and we reassure all our guests of the following: 1. This tour is for 10 hours and is fully customizable. We are more than happy to adjust your itinerary to include or exclude anything you'd like. It is our usual policy to dive deeper into your itinerary when we pick you up from your hotel so everyone is happy with the plan for the day. With our wealth of experience heading to all the major sightseeing spots on the island, we will ensure that your journey is as smooth as possible. 2. There will be absolutely NO forced shopping on our tours. Other guides in Bali might offer you low prices upfront to secure your booking but then proceed to bring you on a merry-go-round of stores to earn commission from your purchases. We do not play such games with our guests. Should you do decide to go shopping of your own accord, there is no pressure to buy whatsoever. 3. You will be guided by an experienced licensed guide from our team who is fluent in English. We know that clear communication from our guides is key for guests to have a fruitful experience in Bali. As such, we go to great lengths to ensure that your guides have the requisite level of English (as well as experience) to guide you through your day comfortably.

strIntroduction: There are few female guides in Bali because females are traditionally more involved in the household and community. I can bring you to key sights in Bali such as Uluwatu, Tanah Lot, Ubud art villages, Goa Gajah temple to name a few. I can also explain about the history, culture, and traditions of Balinese lifestyle in each location. This tour is fully customizable and can be tweaked based on your preferences. Let me know what you would like to see and I will plan an itinerary for you. Here is an example of a suggested itinerary: A. Kintamani Authentic Experience: 1. Balinese Traditional House. Visiting a traditional house is beginning way to know the culture of Bali. 2. Batuan Village Temple. The temple architecture and carvings are very beautiful and distinctive. To visit the temple becomes a memorable experience during your vacation to Bali. 3. Mount and lake Batur. The view of mount and lake Batur is one of the favorite destinations in Bali and it become an icons of tourism attractions in Kintamani. 4. Bali herbs and coffee plantation. Instead of oranges, Kintamani is also renowned of Arabica and Robusta coffee. YOu can taste the coffee that will be served with a variety of flavors of traditional making process. The Chivet Coffee (Luwak Coffee) is also one of the favorite choices of the coffee products. 5. Gunung Kawi holy temple. The complex of Gunung Kawi temple is built to honor the Udayana King. In this area you will get a calm and peaceful atmosphere. It is located on the bank of the rivers. This temple is the ideal place to meditate, pray, and sightseeing. B. Tanah Lot tour 1. Tanjung benoa water sport. 2. Tanah Lot temple. The temple that is located on a large offshore rock. 3. Canggu beach. To enjoy the sunset and walk along the beach. C. Bedugul and Jatiluwih Tour 1. Taman Ayun (World UNESCO heritage). The Royal Temple of Mengwi Empire which is surrounded by the big fish pond and look like a drift on the water 2. Bedugul and Ulundanu temple. Enjoy the scenery in Ulundanu Temple and beratan lake 3. Jatiluwih Rice field (World UNESCO Heritage). The one of famous Traditional Irrigation System in Bali (Subak) D. Uluwatu tour: 1. Pandawa Beach 2. Uluwatu Temple : Set on a cliff bank with a stunning view of the Indian ocean 3. Jimbaran Bay: Enjoy a freshly-grilled seafood dinner at one of the best beaches in Bali. If you are looking for a female guide for your female group while in Bali, then join me on this tour!

strIntroduction: Boasting some of the most diverse reefs on the planet, Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida are must-visit locations for a snorkeling trip while you are in Bali. The pristine corals and warm waters are home to schools of vibrantly colored fish like the emperor angel fish, parrot fish, morray eels, turtles and in certain areas, manta rays! A recent survey by marine biologists has revealed over 250 species of fish! We have full time snorkeling guides who will help you with your equipment and life jackets. Flotation devices will also be provided for those that are not so comfortable in the water. Our specially designated snorkeling areas make snorkeling in Lembongan a safe and enjoyable activity for all ages! Some of the snorkel sites we will visit: 1. CRYSTAL BAY Famous for its excellent visibility of up to 40m+ on a good day. The highlight of your trip with healthy live coral reef and hundreds of fish of all shapes and sizes 2. MANTA POINT The boat ride out to Manta Point is almost as exciting as the snorkeling trip itself, as it offers divers incredible views of the towering sea cliffs of Nusa Penida. The plankton-rich waters here attract the mantas all year round, sometimes seven or eight at a time. Snorkeling with Mantas will definitely be the highlight of your trip. 3. TOYA PAKEH / GAMAT BAY This snorkel site sprawling coral garden with plenty of fish and very light currents. You will find there one of the most crystal clear water of Bali. You will see big sponges, nudibranch, mantis shrimps, cowries, cleaner shrimps & moray eels. Shoals of colorful anthias cover the corals, trigger fish, puffer fish, stingrays and keep an eye on the blue for the occasional Reef Shark, Barracuda or giant Trevally passing by. In addition to snorkeling, this tour also includes a delicious beachside lunch of any item off the menu (the grilled fish is excellent) at Paradise Beach as well as a mangrove tour on Kayak, or stand up paddle board or private gondola ride from 2.30 - 3pm! It's the perfect way for you to enjoy a day out on the water! *The snorkel spots depend on the weather condition: Manta Point, Crystal Bay and Mangrove Point if the weather is good Toya Pakeh wall, Ceningan Wall and Mangrove Point if there is a big swell. ITINERARY: - 08.00 : Pick up from your hotel lobby (if you are staying in Ubud, pick up is at 07.30am and if you are staying in the Sanur area, pick up is at 8:30am) (Round trip hotel transfers included from Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Sanur, Canggu and Ubud) - 09.30 : Depart from Sanur by fast boat. - 10.45 - 13.30 : Snorkeling sessions at 3 different spots (approx. 30 min in each location) around Nusa Penida & Nusa Lembongan (depending on the water conditions). - 13.30 - 14.30 : Beach side lunch at Paradise Beach. - 14.30 - 15.00 : Mangrove tour with Kayak, stand up paddle board or private gondola ride (depending on availability). - 16.00 : Depart from Nusa Lembongan by fast boat. - 17.00 : Return transfer to your hotel. NOTE: If you would like us to take your photos with our professional underwater camera, please be sure to book the option called "Add on: Photos from our underwater camera (CD included)". We will give you a CD with your images or you can bring a thumb drive to transfer them if you would like. *Life Vests Available For Poorer Swimmers
strTitle: 25% OFF Bali Snorkeling: Nusa Lembongan Snorkeling Day Trip

strIntroduction: For a fabulous afternoon of peace and serenity, join us in the heart of Bali at our romantic 5-star boutique resort, which is enclosed by three hectares of lush tropical gardens overlooking the spectacular Ayung River valley and rice paddies. Here, our unique spa (built using natural materials and perched at the top of a mango tree) invites you to pamper your senses with a 60 minute relaxing massage in your very own couple treatment room. Every ingredient and ritual here is drawn from a page of the L’Occitane grand herbarium, a resource of hundreds of essential oils and natural ingredients. During your massage, the soothing sounds of the Ayung River below will lull you into a state of total relaxation. You will enjoy 2 choices of Spa Treatments: 1. Balinese Massage: Ideal for those with chronic fatigue. This traditional massage combines palm and thumb pressures to reduce tension, fatigue, and improve lymphatic flow and muscle relaxation. This massage also helps to improve blood circulation and ease stress. 2. Relaxing Massage: Ideal for persons with sleeping issues. Swedish effleurage, Chinese acupressure and Balinese massage technique come together to stimulate circulation, ease tension & release stress. Aromachologie essential oils – lavender, tea tree and geranium – ensure complete relaxation. The body and mind will feel truly calm after this treatment. After your spa treatment, choose from one of these 3 options below to experience fabulous views overlooking the greenery of Ubud while tucking into a cosy tea or private dinner with your loved one. ****************************************************************************************** 3 MEAL OPTIONS - please choose the correct one from the drop down box when you are making your booking. OPTION 1: TWILIGHT DINNER MENU AT OUR LOBBY POND The Lobby Pond is located at our chapel next to our reception area. Surrounded by the still water of the pond, candles and flower arrangements, the Lobby Pond is the perfect venue for your romantic soirée. To protect your privacy during the romantic dinner, bamboo curtains will be drawn to separate the reception area from the Lobby Pond. Mise en bouche Chef’s pre-dinner appetiser to awaken your tastebuds *** Carpaccio di salmone e cape sante all’olio e limone Salmon and Sea Scalllop Carpaccio with lemon and olive oil dressing *** Zuppa Dolce Red pepper Fresh Blended Capsicum served with Sour Cream *** Amarena Coupe Gelati Minty lime sorbet with lemoncello to cleanse the palate *** Costata di Manzo Angus Americano alla Griglia con Patate el Rosmarino Char grilled prime steak with black pepper and mash potatoes - Or - Aussie Media Agnello Rack Potatoes fondant, BBQ Veggie burnt rosemary and Mint Agar *** Magic Chocolate Fondue *** Tea or Coffee OPTION 2: ROMANTIC DINNER AT OUR BIRD'S NEST Another romantic yet private venue in our resort is our Bird's Nest. As you can see in the photo, it is inspired by a bird's nest to give two love bird's their perfect private moment. With a spectacular view of the Ayung River below as well as Ubud's valley spread out before you, this is a one-of-a-kind sunset dining experience. Mise en bouche *** Smoked Salmon Platter Capers, Pink Peppercorn and Pickles *** Portobello Cream Soup *** Limoncello Sorbet *** Beef tenderloin "Chateaubriand" "Mashed potatoes, candied garlic, portobello confit & organic vegetables" or Pan seared snapper fillet, Poached Prawn with Herb Butter Sauce, Scallop with Lemongrass Skewer Served with wild Mushroom basil risotto, creamy saffron sauce *** Magic Chocolate Fondue *** Tea or Coffee NOTE: Vegetarian menus are available upon request (can be served at either the Lobby Pond or Bird's Nest location) DINNER SCHEDULE: 1st shift : 6:00 PM (you can choose a start time of 4.30pm for your massage) 2nd shift : 9:00 PM (you can choose a start time of 7.30pm for your massage) ** If you're looking to propose to your special lady, we can also arrange a romantic wedding proposal set up which includes four standing rose bouquets, a white rose centre piece on the table, floating white roses on the pond and petals of 100 roses on the aisle ** (see the drop down list for prices) WINE TO BOOK AS AN ADD-ON : White Wine Bottle : Alexandria Alexandria is made from the Belgia grapes grown in Hatten Wines’ vineyards. The grapes, ripe and sugar-filled, are processed to bring the very fruity and perfumed grape flavour to its delightful taste. Sweet wines are appreciated as some of the most complex and impressive flavours and aromas in the wine world. This medium-sweet white wine is very aromatic with grapey characters and lovely floral perfume. The fruity palate is well balanced between sweetness and acid, leaving a refreshing aftertaste. The wine takes its name from the Muscat of Alexandria, with which it finds similarities in flavour. Red Wine Bottle : Two Islands Merlot Sourcing the best fruit from iconic regions throughout South Australia, Two Islands Wines are crafted to offer distinct Australian wine characteristics, deliver great tasting wines of superior quality, character and consistency. Vinified in Bali, they bring you South Australia in a bottle – in Bali.
strTitle: Romantic Spa & Twilight Dinner or Tea in Ubud

strIntroduction: Only Bali Adventure Tours offers this exclusive stretch of unexplored part of Ayung river in a choice of two daily rafting sessions over 33 rapids where you will travel through formerly unseen river splendor on the first section of the tour with daring, exciting and challenging new rapids to add to the thrill of Bali’s longest white water rafting trip. The class 2 & 3 rapids include encounters on vortexes of swirling and funneled waters, natural ramps and sudden drops in elevation and adrenaline pumping action which can be safely experienced by anyone from 5-65 years of age. ITINERARY FOR MORNING SESSION 09.00 Arriving at the Ubud Adventure & Function Centre Registration Process, Bracelet Distribution and Storing Valueable Items at Locker and Change for Rafting 09.30 Shuttle to Start Point of Rafting Outfitting and Briefing from the Guide 10.00 Rafting 12.00 Finish Rafting 12.15 Shower and Changes, Purchase Photos & DVD (additional charge) 12.30 Lunch at The Canopy 13.30 Depart from Ubud Adventure & Function Centre PICKUP times for MORNING session Nusa Dua 07.00 - 07.30 am Kuta/Seminyak 07.00 - 07.30 am Sanur 07.30 - 08.00 am Ubud 08.15 - 08.45 am PICKUP times for AFTERNOON session Nusa Dua 11.30 - 12.00 pm Kuta/Seminyak 11.30 - 12.00 pm Sanur 12.00 - 12.30 pm Ubud 12.30 - 01.00 pm
strTitle: 50% OFF White Water Rafting Ayung, Bali Adventure Tours

strIntroduction: Our 2 hour rides go out through the rice fields where the method of farming has changed little over the centuries, down to the black volcanic sand beach where you can trot and canter with the sound of the surf in your ears and the sea spray on your face. We then return to the stables via the traditional village of Pererenan with its temples and friendly people, to a well deserved cold drink and an original home made Balinese snack. If you prefer shorter trips, feel free to book our half hour or 1 hour ride (the start time is flexible for those trips and depend on availability) Whatever your riding experience, we put safety first, so each guest will have one instructor guiding you at all times. PICK UP TIMES FOR THE 2 HOUR MORNING RIDE (9 AM): 07:30hrs ; Kuta, Nusa Dua, Sanur, Denpasar, Ubud 08:00hrs ; Seminyak 08:15hrs - 08:20hrs ; Canggu PICK UP TIMES FOR THE 2 HOUR AFTERNOON RIDE (3 PM): 13:30hrs ; Kuta, Nusa Dua, Sanur, Denpasar, Ubud 14:00hrs ; Seminyak 14:15hrs - 14:20hrs ; Canggu IMPORTANT POINTS: 1. We have a strict weight limit of 90kg. Please include your weights when booking so we can choose the right horse for you before you arrive. 2. Round trip transport is only included in the price for the 2-hour-long ride from Kuta, Legian, Canggu and Seminyak (with a minimum number of 2 guests bookings). If you book shorter rides (30 minutes or 1 hour), please refer to below transport rates when booking. If you prefer to take a taxi on your own, we will give you a phone number to give us a call so you won't get lost. TRANSPORT PRICES (round trip): Canggu: 50,000 IDR per car (up to 5 guests) Kuta/Legian/Seminyak: 100,000 IDR per car (up to 5 guests) Sanur: 250,000 IDR (up to 5 guests) Nusa Dua / Jimbaran / Ubud 350,000 IDR per car (up to 5 guests) 3. We only allow cantering on the beach for experienced riders so if you would like to do that, please book the 2 hour ride. The 1 hour and half hour rides are limited to the rice fields and villages so you will not have much space to do so.
strTitle: Horse Riding on the Beach & through the Rice Fields of Bali

strIntroduction: Bali's traditional healers, know as Balians, dukun or shamans, have been in the international spotlight since the book and movie Eat Pray Love became a worldwide sensation.These traditional healers play an important role in Bali's culture by treating physical and mental illness, removing spells and channeling information from the ancestors. While there are many who claim to be healers, we Balinese know who are legitimate and who are not. Depending on what you would like to get advice or direction on, we can bring you to see these healers or fortune tellers including: - Ketut Liyer - a Balinese medicine man, artist and palmist who was featured in Elizabeth Glibert's "Eat Pray Love". - Cokorda Rai, now 80, who is famous for curing stress and depression-related issues, chronic back and knee problems, headaches and many other maladies. YOU CAN CHOOSE BETWEEN 2 OPTIONS FOR THIS TOUR 1) Traditional Healing / Palm Reading & Spiritual Cleansing tour *recommended for those who would like to experience the purification ritual of the Balinese 08.00: Pick up from your hotel 09.30: Visit to healer OR palm reader in Ubud - you can ask him all the questions you'd like 11.30: Visit to Goa Gajah ('Elephant cave' temple built in the 9th century) 14.00: Lunch in Ubud - we can discuss meal options when we meet you 15.30: Stop by Tirta Empul (one of our beautiful holy spring water temples) for spiritual cleansing ritual 17.00: Leave for your hotel or any place you would like. NOTE: You must let us know if you would prefer to see the healer OR palm reader on this tour above as we only have time for one if you would also like to stop by the holy spring water temple for spiritual cleansing. 2) Traditional Healing & Palm Reading tour *recommended for those who would like to focus on speaking with both the healer and palm reader and asking your questions 08.00: Pick up from your hotel 09.30: Consultation with healer in Ubud 11.30: Visit to palm reader in Ubud - you can ask him all the questions you'd like 14.00: Lunch in Ubud - we can discuss meal options when we meet you 15.30: If we have enough time, stop by either Tirta Empul (holy spring water temple) or Goa Gojah ('Elephant cave' temple built in the 9th century) 17.00: Leave for your hotel or any place you would like.
strTitle: Meet Bali's Local Shamans, Healers & Fortune Tellers

strIntroduction: If you're interested in exploring the true heart and soul of Bali, come and discover our beautiful village of Sidemen, a hidden paradise in the northeastern part of Bali. Take a walk through the beautifully scenic rice terraces (with Mount Agung in the distance) and cross stunning river streams while you take in the picture perfect countryside around you. When you return, enjoy a mouthwatering healthy lunch at Cepik Villa, our chic and welcoming Balinese-style property. A 60 minute Balinese massage in our spa pavilion completes your day with us, pampering you to perfection before we send you on your way (alternatively, you can opt for a private yoga and meditation lesson in the afternoon) This is the Bali you came to discover, so don't leave without coming to see our little piece of paradise! DETAILED ITINERARY - SPA OPTION 07: 00: Pick up from your hotel in Bali 08:30: Arrive at Cepik Villa in Sidemen, enjoy a warm welcome drink of rosella or ginger tea 09:00: Start your morning fresh with a scenic 3-hour-long rice paddy and village trekking experience with our local guide. He will lead you to cross some shallow rivers, and take you on a hidden path to discover the best views in the area. You will even visit a local tile factory on the way back and see how they still make them by hand. 12:00: Return to base camp at Cepik Villa and enjoy a refreshing freshly-picked young coconut 13:00: Tuck into a healthy, organic lunch overlooking the countryside 15:00 Enjoy a 60 minute exotic Balinese massage at our spa pavilion 16:15: Leave for your hotel 18:00: Arrive back at your hotel DETAILED ITINERARY - YOGA OPTION 07: 00: Pick up from your hotel in Bali 08:30: Arrive at Cepik Villa in Sidemen and enjoy a warm welcome drink of rosella or tea 09:00: Start your morning fresh with a scenic 3-hour-long rice paddy and village trekking experience with our local guide. He will lead you to cross some shallow rivers, and take you on a hidden path to discover the best views in the area. You will even visit a local tile factory on the way back and see how they still make them by hand. 12:00: Return to base camp at Cepik Villa and enjoy a freshly picked young coconut to refresh yourself 13:00: Tuck into a healthy, organic lunch overlooking the countryside 15:00: Balance your mind with a 1.5-hour-long meditation and yoga session 16:15: Leave for your hotel 18:00: Arrive back at your hotel Additional activities we can arrange: - A visit to a local weaver's house (no formal fee, just a small donation for the family) - Egg painting activity
strTitle: Relaxing Day Trip to Sidemen: Trekking, Lunch & Spa/Yoga

strIntroduction: While Gitgit is the most visited waterfall in Bali and Aling-Aling is the most fun waterfall, the Sekumpul waterfalls are often considered the most beautiful in Bali. Sekumpul means “a group of”, and there are 7 waterfalls here on the north side of Bali (further east of Lovina) that you can view. The drive is long and it takes a whole day, but you’ll barely meet other visitors there and the pure serenity that awaits you is unforgettable! POTENTIAL ITINERARY 1 (everything is customisable depending on how long you want to stay at the waterfalls) 09.00 - 09.30: Stop at the village of Tegalalang for one of the best rice paddy views in Bali 09.30 - 10.00: Stop at Ceking village to visit a coffee and herb plantation - get a taste of Bali's famous civet coffee or 'kopi luwak' 11.30 - 13.30: 12.00: Drive to Sekumpul waterfall area. Get on a 10 min motorbike ride to the starting point then walk down the steps to the river for the first waterfall. Explore the remote and serene area on foot. You can even swim under some of the falls! 15.00: Leave for a late lunch at Kintamani with a fantastic view of the Mount Batur Volcano 16.00: Visit Tirta Empul temple - one of the holiest spring water temples on the island 17.30: Leave for your hotel 19.30: Arrive back in your hotel POTENTIAL ITINERARY 2: 09.00-10.00: Visit Bali's famous lake temple - Pura Ulun Danu Bratan 12.00: Arrive at Sekumpul waterfall area. Get on a 10 min motorbike ride to the starting point then walk down the steps to the river for the first waterfall. Explore the remote and serene area on foot. You can even swim under some of the falls! 14.30: Come back to the car then go to have lunch at Mount Batur 15.30: Leave for Tegalalang - one of the best rice paddy views in Bali 16.10: Spend time visiting Tegalalang rice paddies 17.30: Leave to come back to your hotel 19.30: Arrive back in your hotel PICK UP TIMES: 8am: Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Sanur, Seminyak, Kuta 8.30am: Ubud area NOTE: There are local guides at Sekumpul who will accompany you to the main falls. I will accompany you part of the way to make sure you are in good hands (my knees are weak these days...) There will be an extra charge of IDR50,000 (approximately US$4) per person for the bike ride to the starting point and the local guide's fee. Also, the local village charges entrance fees to the falls, but this changes from time to time and I will advise you during the tour as to what the current ticket prices are (right now it is 30,000 IDR per person, or approximately US$2)
strTitle: Visit the Sekumpul waterfalls - Bali's most beautiful falls!

strIntroduction: The people of Trunyan are from a traditional village in Bali known as 'Bali Aga', or 'Old Bali'. These people from Trunyan Village live a very traditional daily life that is vastly different from the rest of Bali. The Trunyanese do not cremate their dead. After a cleansing ritual, the dead body is placed in a bamboo cage (locally known as ancak saji) under the Taru Menyan tree. Taru Menyan means ‘nice smelling tree’. This tree emanates a scent that neutralizes the smell of rotting bodies. It is also this tree from which the name Trunyan is derived. Furthermore, typical to the funeral rites of Trunyan, is that only the bodies of married people are allowed to be placed in bamboo cages. I grew up in Trunyan village's neighboring village, hence I have very good relations with the villagers and will be able to bring you to places that other guides cannot. I will also ensure that you have an enjoyable experience there and that nobody in the village will hassle you for extra payments - the people in Trunyan village are notoriously known to hassle and cheat tourists if you do not have the right guide. This tour will include a visit to the Trunyan Cemetery, a ride in the traditional fishermen boat (pedau), and insights into local beliefs about corpse and funeral processes in Trunyan. Trunyan Village is located in the east of Batur Lake and can be accessed by car. In this village, you will learn about the housing and traditional lifestyle of the Trunyan people. You will also visit the old temple of Ratu Gede Pancering Jagat in Trunyan. ITINERARY: 09.00 Hotel Pick Up 11.00–11.30 Trunyan Village Tour 11.30–11.45 Traditional Boat From Village to the Cemetery 11.45 – 12.30 Cemetery Tour 12.30 – 12.45 Traditional Boat back from Cemetery to the Village 14.00–15.00 Lunch in Kintamani (not included in price) 15.30-16.00 To visit a gallery of disabilities' painting and other products (Shiny Pearl Ubud Foundation) 17.30 Arrive Back in Hotel
strTitle: Visit the Ancient Trunyan Village with a Local

strIntroduction: First hike will be exploring the Campuhan Ridge. Campuhan is a sacred area and means ‘where two rivers meet’ - Sungai Wos and Sungai Agung. This river valley is a stunning area to walk around and do some exploring on the narrow paths. After an hour hiking in Campuhan Ridge, we will continue to explore the scenic Tegalalang Rice field, located a quick 20 minutes away from Campuhan Ridge.This scenic drive will take you through the countryside of Ubud. Tegalalang Rice Field is the most visited rice field in Bali. It is designed very beautifully with exquisite patterns located precisely on a hill bank. Witness the local farmers planting their rice in oblique areas complete with its traditional irrigation system called Subak. Enjoy the beauty and greenery of rice and its valley with coconut trees on it. Bali Pulina located just 5 minutes driving from Tegalalang Rice Field will be the next stop on the trip. Bali Pulina is a hiden organic plantation where we can learn how Balinese Coffee is made. It is the best place for sampling the different coffee, tea, pure cocoa, and organic spices with a very beautiful rice field and valley setting. Bali Pulina also has the most unique coffee in world called Luwak Coffee. If you haven't heard about it already, this is a rare type of coffee partially fermented by passing it through the digestive system of a civet cat. The cats eat only the best berries and the stones are collected after they pass through their digestive system. Legend has it that drinking Kopi Luwak is good for fertility. The hike will be completed by a trip to Gunung Kawi , the 11th-century temple complex nestled among rice paddies and thick jungle in Tampaksiring, north-east of Ubud. To get there, you need to conquer some 270 steps, but it’s a special place well worth the effort. The huge shrines are carved into the cliffs at both sides of Pakerisan River connected by a stone bridge. It is also known as a World Heritage site by UNESCO 2012 located along Pekerisan River. Itinerary: 07.00 - Hotel pick up at Kuta, Nusa Dua, Sanur Area. 08.00 - Hotel Pick up at Ubud Area. 09.00 - Ubud Eco Walk (1 hour rice field walk). 10.15 - Leaving Ubud Area for Tegalalang Rice Field. 10.45 - Exploring and hiking Tegalalang Rice Field for 1 hour 13.00 - Lunch at Alon Alon Restaurant overlooking Tegalalang Rice Field. 14.30 - Bali Pulina to explore organic spices plantation and taste the most unique coffee worldwide called Luwak Coffee overlooking scenic valley with rice field on it. 15.15 - Leaving for Gunung Kawi. 15.45 - Explore Gunung Kawi with its beautiful surroundings (Waterfall, River, Rice Field Ancient Temple). 17.00 - Heading back to your hotel through the beautiful Balinese countryside
strTitle: Go on an Eco Walk around Ubud

strIntroduction: Join my husband and I for a full day of food and fun in a traditional family compound. Morning class starts at 8.30am (includes market tour) Afternoon class starts at 4pm (excludes market tour) The morning portion of our day starts out with a stroll through the colorful Ubud market, where the locals gather to buy their produce. I will show you the fresh array of herbs and spices, vegetables and meat available, and you will get to taste some delicious Balinese snacks and cakes, as well as marvel at the variety of flowers on sale. Next, we take a short ride back to my home village in Laplapan (a quick 10-minute drive from central Ubud), stopping at a scenic rice field along the way to show you how rice is grown. Upon arrival at my home, you can enjoy a refreshing welcome drink as my husband Wayan and I explain how Balinese families live in a traditional family compound. After this explanation, we continue our culinary journey with a tour of my herb garden, and kitchen, where we use traditional woks, steamers and mortar and pestles to make our food delicious. This class is completely hands-on, and you will get to see how we create a some classic local dishes in no time at all. Afterward, settle down in our very own backyard to tuck into a sumptuous feast! As I know everyone comes from different countries, I make it a point to explain what kinds of ingredients you can use in your own kitchen to replicate the unique taste and flavor of these Balinese dishes. Here is an example of some of the dishes we will be cooking: Kuah Wong - Clear Mushroom & Vegetable Soup Be Siap Mesanten - Chicken in Coconut Curry Sate Siap - Minced Chicken Grilled on Bamboo Sticks Kacang Me Santok - Vegetables in Peanut Sauce Jukut Urab - Coconut and Snake Bean Salad Pepesan Be Pasih - Steamed Fish in Banana leaves Tempe Me Goreng - Deep fried Tempe in Sweet Soy Sauce Kolak Biu - Boiled Banana in Palm Sugar Syrup You will receive a recipe book that you can take home after the class.
strTitle: Whip up a Feast in a Traditional Balinese Compound in Ubud

strIntroduction: We pamper you with five-star service and give you a choice of 2 menus to choose from. Whether you're celebrating a birthday, an anniversary or even proposing to your significant other, let our private pavilion serve as the location for a special night in Bali. Below are the 2 menus for you to choose from. We can accommodate special requests, though, so just let us know what you need and we will make it happen! If you would like to see the light change over the rice paddies in the evening, we suggest an early start time of 6.30pm.
